characters: BETWEEN DOM AND EGOROV ON THE PHONE
OPENED DOSSIER OF LT. COLONEL IVANOVICH EGOROV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A songbird chirps outside. Gazing out windows at a magnificent rooftop view of Bruss in the hush before daybreak. To the right of the windows, vanity with a large mirror and a sleeping cat on its tabl The naked, tangled bodies of a YOUNG WOMAN and an OLDER M asleep on a bed can be seen in the mirror. A serene still as the sun breaks and floods the bedroom with warm light. SUPER: "Brussels, Belgium. March, 1976" IN THE MIRROR we see the woman roused by the sun. A beat. She beckons for his... Massages it to attention. Sliding his chest, she straddles him. Husky gasps as she graceful grinds down. The half-asleep man comes alive with her ple meets her movement, intensity building, their shuddered breaths become one --- until he cums and they collapse together... ANGLE ON BED: sun-stroked lovers in a hazy embrace --- st with satisfaction, comfort --- good morning. DOMINIKA EGOROV: mid twenties, natural, effortless beauty deep allure --- bohemian laissez-faire style and grace -- Jane Birkin but with haunted eyes. Next to her, COLONEL FRANCOIS GUILLOT, a Belgian man, 50s Kissing Guillot, Dom gets out of bed, grabs the portable cassette player off the vanity --- a glance back at him a she disappears into the bathroom. Guillot leans to a chair, a NATO uniform hanging off it. pulls out a cigarette, lights up, takes a drag, smiles to himself as we HEAR water running into a tub in the bathro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom in front of a mirror, not so much looking at herself she is for herself. An undercurrent of tension in her eye Moving to the clawfoot tub next to a big window, Dom cuts the water, hits play on her tape-deck: The Velvet Underground's "Sunday Morning" --- slips into the bath. The tension in her eyes disappears when Guillot enters. H gets in the tub, sits across from her. They trade smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: When we're old and gray -- promise me that we will still have mornings like this. Always this --- forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A proposal?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: We only met 6 weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: But I've known you for a thousand years --- Dom rolls her eyes, a "so cheesy" look at Guillot. Puttin her feet on his chest, he soaps and lathers her legs up..

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: The NATO Colonel and the anti-war activist --- an odd couple.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: You're the ying, I'm the yang. Dom grabs a safety razor, slowly begins to shave her legs

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: And what will your colleagues say?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: What will yours? (lock eyes with Dom) I don't care. I want us to work.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: How am I to live happily ever after with a career soldier?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: I am a soldier for peace.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: Yes, whose job it is to promote the proliferation of nuclear weapons ---

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: As deterrents!

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: Do you want our children to grow up under the specter of annihilation?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: Of course not ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then help me change things. You're a soldier for peace? Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. Prove it how? Dom stops shaving, hard look at Guillot.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: Is the Defense Planning Committee going to advocate the deployment of Pershing II GLCM's along the curtain line to counter Soviet SS-20's? Guillot sits back and stares at her, stunned and confused

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: I.. I'm sorry -- I can't answer that.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: You mean you won't...

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: You're deputy chief of NATO's Division of Defense Planning and Policy. If anyone knows, it's you.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: How could -- I never told you I was with the DDPP. We never discussed -- Dom's gaze unwavering as the realization hits Guillot lik bat to the head.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: You're from the Center, aren't you? You're from Moscow.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: If I were, would it make a difference? He shuts his eyes, annihilated.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: Francois --- Guillot starts to cross his arms --- Dom leans in to touc him, prevent him from closing up --- and he SLAPS her har drawing blood. He recoils, horrified at himself, at her. remains calm, maintains eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are snapshots of us, documents that I photographed. (beat) If you don't work for them, they have more than enough to convince your colleagues that you do --- Guillot breaks down with a shattered, gallows chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: A honeytrap. Pathetic. Can't trust anyone anymore. Not even myself.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: I do care about you, Francois --- let me help you through this.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: What you do for a living -- it's the worst fucking business in the world. Dom nods. After a beat ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: But there's no other way out --- Guillot suddenly snatches the safety razor...

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: There's always a way out. Dom lunges for the razor, but Guillot JAMS his legs hard against her chest and PINS her back. He pops out the blad looks her dead in the eye and brutally slits open his wri Guillot roughly holds a struggling Dom still as a cloud o blood gushes from his veins and into the water towards he and after a minute or so, he finally releases her. Dom ju out of the bath, body stained with blood.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this. Guillot reclines to bleed out in comfort. Finally Dom tur wets a towel in the sink, quickly cleaning herself.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLOT, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: You can wipe the blood off, but you and I will always be unfinished business. They share a last look. He turns to gaze out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN FRENCH)
dialogues.text: I'll let the cat out when I leave. Dom leaves the bathroom. After a few beats, her footstep rushing out of the apartment -- she shuts the door. And t all we can hear is a song bird CHIRPING outside. SUPER TITLE CREDIT: "Red Sparrow"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drab, cramped living room sullied with the rubble of an a night party. A pile of THREE NAKED BODIES passed out on t floor. Woman's SNORES over a radiator's wheeze. SUPER: "Two Months Later. Moscow, Soviet Union" Sandwiched between two plump BRITISH CHICKS is NATE NASH, 30-something American with the wolfish, hardboiled good l of a prizefighter. Unkempt, counter-culture vibe. Waking up, Nate squints at his watch: 8:47am -- shit. He wiggles free and gathers his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a brown corduroy suit, blue Lacoste shirt and military boots, Nate turns the sink on, vigorously splashes his fa On the counter: a new bar of soap and bottle Chanel perfu He sticks both in his jacket. The plump chick's panties a bra hang over the tub. Nate pockets those too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate pops a couple of Dexedrine with some water --- then grabs a half-eaten steak, four eggs, apples from the frid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We suddenly hear the Rolling Stones' "Jiving Sister Fanny kick in --- as Nate exits the building next to the Britis Embassy wearing a bucket hat and mirrored aviators. Storm clouds rolling in, he flips his collar up, heads fo the gate. The EMBASSY SOLDIERS glare -- which Nate return with a snarky grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUING --- Outside the gate is a checkpoint gua by FOUR SOVIET MILITIAMEN. As Nate passes through, he smo shifts into a hungover stagger. Nate snap scans the street, casually clocks a VOLGA idlin down the block, two guys in the front seat.  6. Lumbering down the sidewalk, Nate suddenly keels over aga the wall and covertly sticks his finger down his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUING --- KGB#1 and KGB#2 chuckle as they watc Nate puke then head to his car, a beat-up, tangerine Zhig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate listens to the Stones off a jerry-rigged 8-track tap player as he drives the drab and dreary streets. He crack the eggs over his mouth, swallows them whole -- powering Sunday morning traffic, easy for Nate to clock his KGB coverage: a rotation of 24 VEHICLES floating around him. Nate memorizes characteristics of each car: dinged bumper the Volga, mismatched tire on the Lada van, etc...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (mumbling to himself) Fred and Barney in the dinged rear bumper. Tom and Jerry, oddball tire -- Stopping at a red light, Nate's about to take a bite of s when the Volga behind him lurches forward and rear ends h hurling Nate into the steering wheel... Fucking pissed, Nate whips back to look at the smiling KG and KGB#4. Has to restrain himself from stomping ass.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking cocksuckers in the Volga...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music ends as Nate parks his car, gets out and enters the Sandunovsky Banya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KGB#5 and #6, already in towels, sit on the bench behind Nate as he disrobes, puts his gear into his locker. Weari his bucket hat and towel, Nate leaves, KGB agents trailin A beat later, more KGB AGENTS rush to Nate's locker. KGB# has a key, opens it and they rifle through his things. KG pulls the perfume, sprays it, smells -- pockets it. KGB#7 pulls the bra and panties out, holds them up. The c gazes at them like they're looking into the face of god. KGB#9 swipes the panties from KGB#7. A tussle busts out -

dialogues.speaker: ENOUGH
dialogues.text: An annoyed KGB SKIPPER holds his hand out and they give the panties and bra.

dialogues.speaker: KGB SKIPPER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Dust him and be done with it. KGB#7 spritzes invisible NPPD dust on Nate's shoes, cloth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large Banya steamroom packed to the hilt with Muscovite sweating it out, shooting the shit. Nate sits on the 2nd tier bench, boiling down good, KGB on either side of him.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (turns to KGB on right) So the KGB, the GRU and the CIA all think they're the world's best rabbit catchers. To settle the matter, they have a contest --- see how long it takes each team to catch the rabbit. The CIA is up first. They charge into their forest and pay off all the animals, place informants throughout, vector every inch with satellites -- and after 3 months of working it, the CIA concludes that the rabbit doesn't exist. Next, the GRU team goes into their forest and after a week with no leads they get fed up and just drop a nuke on the whole place, fucking vaporize everything, including the rabbit. No apologies. Fuck the rabbit, he had it coming. Then, finally the KGB's team goes into their forest --- and they come out 10 minutes later with this big old bear who's clearly had the living shit kicked out him --- missing his teeth, an eye, bleeding out of his ass --- and the bear's screaming: "Okay! Okay! I'm the fucking rabbit! I'm the rabbit!" Nate explodes with crazy laughter and to his delighted surprise everyone in the steam joins him... Everyone but KGBs --- who struggle not to laugh. Nate tosses KGB#5 his bar of soap --- marches out of the steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark clouds loom. Nate ambles down the sidewalk toting an umbrella, hyper-aware but feigning indifference. A BIG-NO MAN averts his eyes as Nate walks past. Boom, motherfucke just got made. Nate approaches a CINEMA with "One Flew Over The Cuckoo' Nest" on the marquee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An over-packed old theater --- VIEWERS sit in the aisles, stand against the walls. KGB#7&8 sit a few rows behind Na All eyes on the last scene when the Chief kills McMurphy. Credits roll, APPLAUSE. Everyone shuffles to the exit simultaneously, creating a dense mob of bodies. KGB#7 and #8 lose Nate, panic, shove through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light rain. KGB#¥9 & #10 in their car across from the the watching the crowd exit. KGB#9 lifts a UV scope to his ey POV SCOPE: checking people's feet --- among the bustle, a pair of shoes glows. PAN UP to see the back of Nate in th rush as he opens his umbrella. In a panic KGB#7 & #8 emerge from theater, hurry to the V

dialogues.speaker: KGB
dialogues.text: (nods to Nate) He's going to his car. Relieved, they all hustle after him... ANOTHER ANGLE: Amidst the hurrying throngs trying to get of the rain, we catch the back of a MAN strolling down th block, trench coat collar popped, newsboy cap on. A glove hand holds an open umbrella. As he distances himself, we now see this is Nate, no sunglasses, different shoes -- he turns onto another stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF QUICK CUTS: Nate moving down rainy avenues, bac streets, etc. Making sure he's clean of surveillance. He turns down an alley, disappears behind a tall wood fence A LOADING DOCK FOR A BUTCHER. Nate pulls two garbage bags from a trash can. He opens one: a scrub brush and soap bo Looping a hose off the awning, Nate showers, naked and shivering -- furiously scrubbing his skin, nails, scalp.. Nate then opens the second bag, pulls out a towel, a new of clothes and shoes --- and a set of car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate in another car, a Lada. Pops a couple more Dexedrine  QUICK SERIES OF CUTS: Nate driving through choke points, across bridges, switch-backing -- every detection move in the book... Nothing suspicious. He sold it, they bought i he's black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate cautiously approachs a desolate apartment block with messenger bag slung from his shoulder --- Situational awareness peaking, pulse racing, Nate snap-sc the street for anything suspect --- doesn't see anything. enters the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate enters the dimly-lit room, descends the steps, appro another door. KNOCKS softly. And from behind Nate a VOICE

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Hands up --- above your head. (Nate complies) Now turn around please. Nate slowly turns to find GRU MAJOR GENERAL VLADIMIR KORC a rugged, majestically-handsome man in his late-50s. Korc gives him a hard once-over and takes out the same UV scop the KGB used and carefully scans Nate for luminescence.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: (robust, elegant accent) So how long was your run? Nate holds out his hands to be scanned.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: 15 hours. Been black for the last 5. Satisfied, Korch cracks a warm smile and pulls Nate into big, soul-brother bear hug and plants a big kiss on his c

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: I'm so happy to see you, my friend ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Me too, chico ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korch ushers Nate into a modest janitor apartment, remove Nate's jacket, hangs it over a radiator and then SETS A COOKING TIMER FOR TWO HOURS. Nate opens his bag, pulls out a shrink-wrapped Russian transistor radio, hands it to Korch.  10.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Inside you'll find batteries for the BUSTER, one time pads, new comm protocols ---

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. Where is the good shit? He gives Korch shrink wrapped bottle of Russian vinegar.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Old Rip Van Winkle. Finest Kentucky bourbon available to mankind ---

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Magnificent! Nate pulls out four shrink wrapped records that have been mocked up to look like they're Russian.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Cash, Elvis and my own contribution, Lee Hazlewood and Nancy Sinatra. You're gonna love it, trust me.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: I do. You and only you. We HEAR Elvis Presley's "Gentle On My Mind", carrying us LATER: Nate and Korch at a table. Nate eats stew. Korch g deep to the Elvis as he smokes.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My wife, Anya, she hated Elvis ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Why?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: For the very reason I love him --- because he lives and sings straight from his balls --- (sad smile) Thought he was vulgar. Through the smile, Nate sees the pain in Korch's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He's got a show up at the Hilton in Las Vegas. You and I could be there by August. Just say the word.  11.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOLI
dialogues.text: Someday perhaps, but for now, we still have work to do. Which reminds me, I must ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No way. We save business for last. That's the rule.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: This is extremely important, Nathan. The subject of intense concern within the Kremlin. It has to do with Kissinger. Some distressing intel --- even Breshnev is upset.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Upset about what?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: (a dramatic beat) Is Kissinger fucking Raquel Welch? Nate flashes a screw-headed grin, but Korch is stonefaced

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it true? Is he defiling her? Nate's grin turns into giggles --- but Korch is insistent

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our sources say that Kissinger has a lopsided cock which becomes quite engorged when erect, is this how he attracts them or just propaganda? Nate's giggles roil into hysterical laughter...

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How does this grotesque, little ghoul of a man bed so many beautiful women? I mean it, Nathan, if I could solve this one mystery, Brezhnev would make me Chief of the GRU... Nate crying, grabs Korch's arm and starts affectionately pounding on it. Korch can't help but start laughing too. LITTLE LATER: Nate and Korch drinking tea. Korch smiles somberly along to Johnny Cash's "A Boy Named Sue."

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I recently read a psychological analysis on all those who spied for or defected to the West --- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (lights cigarette) It isolated a common dominator in all these men.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: They all wanted a better life?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Every one of them had a negative relationship with his father, which is strange, because I had a wonderful bond with my father ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You think he'd see you as a traitor?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: He loved this country, a true patriot.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So are you. You're betraying your government in order to save your people --- Korch finds strength in the conviction in Nate's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: And you? You never speak of your father ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Not much to say. I was a mistake to the man. A bad beat. Only met once.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: He still alive? (off Nate's nod) Tragedy --- he'll never know what a magnificent son he has. (deep sigh) You're the only person in the world I can talk to without having to think about what I'm going to say before I say it. The DING ON THE COOKING TIMER goes off. Both men are heartbroken that their night is coming to an end. Korch pulls on gloves, takes off his boot and unfastens a secret pocket. Nate pulls out a Ziploc bag, holds it open Korch dumps 42 rolls of microfilm into the bag. Nate's st by the volume.  13.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Specs on the RT-21 I.C.B.M's. New command and control system protocols for the VOSTOK. Schematics of Molniya- 4, our new elliptical orbital. Nate gives Korch a look of deep concern.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: This is too much. You shouldn't be drawing so much exposure ---

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: I have it all well in hand...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: But for how much longer? You've had a spectacular, improbable run. Your contribution is impossible to measure. (beat) You've given us enough.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: If your commanders knew you were saying this to me ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd be shit-canned for sure. But I don't want you to end up being burned alive like Penkovsky.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: I won't ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Then let me get you out, we'll set you up with a beautiful new life. You should enjoy the time you have left.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Funny. I was planning on giving you some very similar guidance ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: You don't think I know you're playing the game for the game's own sake? You're a gifted operator, yes --- but with one fatal flaw --- Korch slaps his hand over Nate's heart...

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You've got too much left tit.  14.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Listen, Vlad ---

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: (forceful) No. You, listen. What do you truly want out of life? Who do you want to be? Where do you want to end up when you are my age?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I don't know --- who the fuck has time to think about that shit?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: You must make the time, Nathan --- because it all goes by in the blink of an eye. Nate nods solemnly. Korchnoi reaches into his jacket, pul out a leather-bound book and offers it to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pavel Markova, a mystic poet, my favorite. Read his epic "The Wolf Hunt." Perhaps it'll help you understand what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You know I can't take that.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's been wiped clean. Nate takes the book, puts it and the bag of film into a s pocket in his jacket. They embrace in a soulful hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate exits the building into the misty night. 3:30AM, cit asleep -- he crosses the street and heads down the block. HEADLIGHTS turn onto the street, cruising towards him -- PATROL CAR with TWO MILITIAMEN. Nate shifts to a drunk shuffle. The Militiamen pull up, eyeing him suspiciously, lower the window -- Militia #1 shines a flashlight on Nat

dialogues.speaker: MILITIA
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Nate pretends to be too fucked up to answer --- as he cat the outline of Korch leaving the alley behind the apartme and crossing through the adjacent field.  15. Militia#1 notices Nate's attention flicker and looks that way, sees Korch's shadow, realizes something's up --- whe Nate savagely COLDCOCKS him twice --- Nate BOLTS to a corner apartment block. Militia#2 explode from the car in hot pursuit, screaming into his walkie ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate bursts into the building, frantically looking around where to go --- scrambles up a stairwell --- a beat later Militia#2 busts in, hears Nate's footsteps, follows --- SECOND FLOOR HALL Nate's at the end of the hall, trying t open a big window, but can't. He picks up a trash can and HAMMERS it against the glass --- spiderwebbing it. Just a he's about to swing again ---

dialogues.speaker: MILITIA
dialogues.text: On your knees, hands behind your head! Militia#2 is aiming his gun at Nate from the stairwell. N just smashes the window --- the guy fires a warning shot shattering the window. Realizing what Nate's about to do, Militia#2 charges towa him just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate leaps out of the window and lands hard on his side - SCREAMS in agony.

dialogues.speaker: MILITIA
dialogues.text: He's American! He's American! Nate looks up, sees Militia #2 in the window yelling into his radio. He scrambles to his feet and hobbles away ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate rushes into an alleyway, but it's a dead end. ANOTHE PATROL CAR passes --- screeches to a stop, reverses, and turns into the alley. Headlights sweep over Nate as the Patrol Car accelerates towards him -- Nate going all out -- the car rapidly clos the gap -- MILITIA#3 and #4 open their doors, leaving Nat no room --- going for a wall smear --- Nate veers towards a drain pipe just as Militia#3 guns it towards him.  16. Nate leaps, grabs the pipe and swings up just as the car SMASHES into the wall, sideswipes the drainpipe and grind to a halt, pinning the passenger door closed. The pipe gives way -- Nate drops onto the car's roof, rol onto the pavement. Militia#3 opens the driver door, but Nate body checks it shut on the guy's head --- once -- twice -- three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rains return. TIRE SQUEALS and ENGINE ROARS rise over water slapping asphalt, seemingly from all directions. Wincing in pain, Nate moves in the shadows. The rain fall harder, drowning out other noise. Patrols could be anywhe About to sprint to another alley, Nate suddenly freezes a instinctively pulls back into the dark just as a KGB LADA cruises by. He inches out, looks down the block --- KGB, MORE MILITIA with flashlights and leashed DOGS. The search for Nate intensifying exponentially... Frantically scanning for his next move, Nate spots a stor drain across the street -- a deluge flowing into it. He hustles over, drops to his stomach and tries to squeeze through the opening -- but he doesn't quite fit. He wedge himself in, getting stuck -- THE TORRENT OF RUNOFF WATER

dialogues.speaker: STARTING TO DROWN HIM --
dialogues.text: With his last bit of strength, Nate pulls himself through just as the KGBs patrol past the alley, sweeping their li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate TUMBLES 7 feet into the sewer --- old rusty rebar sl into his side before he splashes hard into a torrent of s water. He immediately vomits from the overwhelming stench Pulls out a flashlight. The pipe running in either direct is only three feet in diameter, half full with water/sewa With no choice, Nate bites on the flashlight, starts craw through the pipe, shivering, struggling to keep his head above the rising river of shit. He crawls away from us, flashlight growing dimmer until we can no longer see it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KGB scours the area while questioning the Militiamen.  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pipe's filling up --- Nate can't keep his head above water and move at the same time. He stops, bracing himself, peers back and ahead. Flips on his back -- a deep breath -- and lets go -- the torrent carrying him away -- roughly spitting him into a CROSS-CH Coming up with a GASP, Nate tries to orient himself befor the raging current pushes him into another pipe -- He scrambles to grab onto a brick wall and SCRATCHES his to an iron ladder --- he latches onto it and pulls himsel up. Nate holds himself, trying to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate emerges from a sewer onto a wide commercial street. has abated. Drained, freezing, he strains to pull the cov back over the manhole. He cuts over to a side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate holds his jacket up to the passenger window of a van and PUNCHES it in. He opens the door, gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate zips up a dirty jump suit, his wet clothes in a pile He rips out wires under the steering wheel, hotwires the van, cranks the heat full blast, and starts driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning. Nate turns onto Tchaikovsky St. and runs r into a gnarly traffic jam. He peers into the distance at line of cars waiting to get into the US EMBASSY. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large compound is surrounded by a tall brick wall top with razor wire. The entrance gate features two checkpoin the outer one manned by Soviet MILITIAMEN, the inner by U MARINES. A line of cars slowly being waved through. The Militiamen examine each car and trunk, checking all occupants against a copy of Nate's diplomatic photo. KGB AGENTS patrol along the lines of backed up cars, look in windows, their GERMAN SHEPHERDS sniffing around.  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate's trying to figure out what to do. He looks over to embassy walls and is suddenly hit with a fucked idea --- He rips the wheel around, peels over the sidewalk and par flush alongside the embassy wall --- He grabs his jacket --- and a canvas tarp --- from the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate scrambles to the roof of the van --- sees a wave of Militiamen and KGB agents screaming towards him on the st He tosses his balled-up jacket up over the wall, then thr the canvas tarp over the razor wire --- jumps up, grabs t top of the wall and uses all his strength to pull himself and over the wall ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate drops down, lands face first in a bush. A whole troo of US MARINES bum rushes towards Nate, Ml6s drawn ---

dialogues.speaker: DON'T MOVE
dialogues.text: Nate throws his hands up. Recognizing Nate, MARINE#1 wave the rest to stand down.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: It's Nash, it's Nash. They all walk over to help him up, but simultaneously sto and recoil from his stench.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Goddamn, Nash, you smell like the inside of a dead man's ass. Nate's too blown out to do anything but smile and nod. Lawrence Welk ELEVATOR MUZAK carries us into ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few CASE OFFICERS sit at desks along the walls. No wind just two cipher doors at both ends of a cramped shoe box room. The muzak on a stereo drowns out the tele-types. Battered but clean, Nate sits at his desk staring at "The Bubble": a hermetically sealed office floating on an air- cushioned platform. Above its door is an illuminated red light bulb and an idle green bulb.  19. The DEPUTY CHIEF OF STATION is eyefucking Nate from the n chair.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY CHIEF OF STATION
dialogues.text: You think you're so fucking special, with your goof attitude, goof clothes --- neverending diplomatic pussy hunts. But I always knew something like this was gonna happen. The light turns red to green. As Nate gets up, The Deputy Chief cuts him a hateful smile.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Harry, no matter what happens in life, there's always some asswipe who knew it would. A few Case Officers chuckle. Nate code opens the Bubble d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring across his desk at Nate is GORDON GONDORFF, CHIEF MOSCOW STATION, mid-forties, beleaguered.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: The D.O. has been screaming over the wire, Benford is apoplectic. Ambassador's getting reamed with calls from the Kremlin --- they want to declare you persona-non-grata.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: They can't PNG me. It's against the rules. Unless they can prove that I was out of pocket, they've got shit.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: The Militia whose jaw you broke ID'd you from the Dip list ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It's his word against mine ---

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: Even if I could stop them from booting you, how can I put you back on the street? You'll have half the goons from the 2nd and 7th Directorates up your ass. Too hot to operate, worthless.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Great! The more resources they put on me, the more we can drain them. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll spend the next 6 months driving around Moscow circle-jerking them off.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: Look, Nash --- you don't need to worry. Your hall file isn't going to take a hit for this ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (explodes with rage) My hall file!? You think I give a shit about that? I have only one concern here. You understand? One. Gondorff's nose starts trickling blood. Nate gestures --

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got a nose bleed again.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: Fucking hermetically-sealed air. Gondorff pulls a few tissues, stuffs them in his nostril. futzes with his nose throughout the rest of the scene.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I appreciate that you care about Marble, but Benford doesn't. He's uneasy with the emotional bond.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The emotional bond is why I swam through a river of shit -- risked my life to get back here with the take. It's why Marble's production has tripled since I've had him in the harness. I'm doing good work here, Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: Look, this incident aside, all of our activity with Marble was going to have to be put on ice for the next 6 months to a year anyway ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What do you mean? (off Gondorff's resistance) C'mon, Gordon, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: The DCI's called a fucked play. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's putting a KEYHOLE satellite over Vorkuta. Should be on station in 4 to 5 days and once it's there, Marble's people are gonna know they have a problem. This sends Nate spinning.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: But they already know what's at Vorkuta. Marble told them!

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: Company's in the shitter right now. Congress has our balls in a vice, the White House has a knife to our throat --- and Bush is a cunt. Wants to put some easy points on the board by giving the president an ace in the hole for the SALT talks ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me? Why didn't you let me warn him?

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: I was given direct orders by Benford. He didn't want to risk Marble holding back on this latest take. Overwhelmed with rage and disgust, Nate pops out of his c

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He's gonna think I knew. He's gonna think I fucked him.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: That's just it, Nate, this isn't about you. The sooner you come to terms with that, the less painful this job's going to be.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The average survival rate for our agents here in Moscow is 11 months. Marble's been out in the wilderness giving us everything for 16 years. And you guys treat him like a fucking dixie cup!?

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: I reached out to Marty Gable, I know he's your rabbi. If you want to be posted to Athens, he'd love to have you. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gets up, offers hand) Thanks for all your work --- Nate doesn't shake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large Dacha (country house) overlooks a rollicking retirement party for a GRU General. Music, kids playing, top echelon of the Soviet complex getting shitfaced... Amid the older heavies is the new wave: KGB LIEUTENANT CO IVANOVICH EGOROV, 36, unconventionally attractive, modish groove, cool confidence. He plays GO and observes the act while holding court at a table of young KGB and GRU shark A military vehicle pulls up to the party. Egorov observes TWO UNIFORMED OFFICERS get out and hurry to the most powe person at the party, DEFENSE MINISTER SERGI GRENCHENKO. T Grenchenko aside, the Officers give him displeasing news. ANGLE ON KORCH: seated on the grass, eyes shut, basking i the sun. VERA, early-50s, radiantly cute, sits next to hi Korch looks over and sees her smiling at him and smiles b delighted to see her. He tenderly kisses her hands.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Vera --- it's so good to see you. How are you? The children?

dialogues.speaker: VERA, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'm much better -- Larisa is still teaching in St. Petersburg and Svetlana's six months pregnant ---

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: VERA, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I just wanted to thank you. The letters you sent after Pavel died meant so much. Knowing you'd come through the loss of Anya. (Beat) You helped me get through the worst of it.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'm glad. Charmingly awkward tension, like teenagers. Interrupted b ROAR OF JABBERING, they turn toward a DEBAUCHED RETIRING GENERAL dancing and crying with a comrade. Vera chuckles.  23.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't laugh. A few more years and I suspect that will be me ---

dialogues.speaker: VERA, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: And then what?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's hard to imagine life outside the Aquarium.

dialogues.speaker: VERA, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (sweet smile) Well perhaps I can help you --- Seeing that Korch is clueless, Vera takes a brave breath, puts her hand on his and locks eyes with him.

dialogues.speaker: VERA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come over for dinner... His surprise flits to delight -- which melts away when he struck with the impossibility of it all. Reading his resignation as rejection, Vera fights back her vulnerabil Korch is about to apologize when a uniformed Soldier appe Gazing across the party at Egorov as he watches Korch and other powerful men heading inside, sensing something's up His suspicion is confirmed when a soldier approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egorov steps into a cozy den and finds Korch; GENERAL AND SOKOLOV, FIRST DEPUTY CHIEF OF THE GRU; two senior-level DEPUTIES for counterintelligence and operations, and A DE FOREIGN MINISTER. Egorov's KGB seniors are irritated by his presence. Unruf by their vicious glares, he nods at them respectfully. Grenchenko, The Defense Minister, rumbles in, sits at a t with six chairs --- everyone but Egorov joins him. In the center of the table, a basket of freshly-picked mushrooms

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I've just received word that the Americans have positioned a KEYHOLE over the Vorkuta research complex --- Easy to see that all but the Dep. Foreign Minister unders the ominous gravity of this revelation.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY FOREIGN MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: If I may ask, what kind of research?  24.

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Multiple independently targetable reentry vehicles for heavy missiles.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY FOREIGN MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: MIRVs are a direct violation of the SALT treaty. If the Americans use this, it will undermine our position for the SALT II talks -- embarrass Chairman Brezhnev --

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Yes yes, I'm not interested in discussing the consequences right now, only the cause --- of which there can only be one. Picking a mushroom from the basket, Grenchenko pulls out pocket knife and slices it into pieces.

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: We've been compromised. And determinations must be made before I can brief the committee --- (eats piece of mushroom) Is this a technical breach? Have our communications been penetrated? Or --- do we have a mole? The table contemplates. No one wants speak first. Korch, especially uptight, throws an acid glare at the KGB guys.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: How many years have I been warning you about this? How many reports have I submitted about just such a breach?

dialogues.speaker: KGB DEPUTY COUNTERINTEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Yes, Vladimir Korchnoi, but we found no conclusive evidence to support your concerns.

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: And now, comrade, is an American satellite conclusive enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: KGB DEPUTY OPERATIONS, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Vorkuta is a military program, over which you asserted complete primacy.

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Enough. If anyone else points a finger, I'll cut if off. I want a determination.  25.

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Vorkuta is one of our most secure programs. Everyone there is quarantined. Only a handful of the senior levels are even aware of its existence. (Beat) The probability is much higher for a technical penetration --- Grenchenko looks at the KGB Deputy Counterintel.

dialogues.speaker: KGB DEPUTY COUNTERINTEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: We are inclined to agree with this initial assessment ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: What about this affair last week with the American ops officer, Nash? Everyone turns to Egorov. KGB guys furious that he spoke.

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Is there a connection?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Aside from the proximity of these events --- Nash went to extraordinary lengths to return to station --- risking his life on several occasions.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: So what of it?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I don't believe he would've gone to such extremes to protect a mere line tap. Only a vital asset.

dialogues.speaker: KGB DEPUTY COUNTERINTEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Have you read our assessment of Nash? The man is a sex fiend, a marginal operator ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: A marginal operator who managed to outwit a 65-man detail, evade a full- scale roundup and was out of pocket for more than 12 hours. The KGB men look like they want to eat Egorov alive.

dialogues.speaker: KGB DEPUTY COUNTERINTEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Yes, I read the report, and while noteworthy, I don't agree there's a connection. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KGB DEPUTY COUNTERINTEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (looks atC@N@ibhenko ) Our resources would be better served focusing on a technical breach.

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I want new security protocols implemented for every organ of the apparatus --- and your action regimes on my desk by tomorrow afternoon. (dismissing everyone) That's it. Everyone gets up and heads towards the door...

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER
dialogues.text: Ivanovich Egorov. I'd like a word. Korch eyes Egorov intently as he exits room with the rest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the men from the meeting leave, Korch pulls Sokolov as

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: This upstart, Egorov, who is he?

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: The dark prince? Vanya Egorov's son ---

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Kruschev's hatchet man at the Center?

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (nods ) Vanya kept a ledger of everyone's dirty secrets. And when he retired, he gave it to his son --- who has used it most effectively.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'd like to see everything we have on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egorov stands casually at attention in front of Grenchenk

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: A technical breach leaves them all blameless --- the easy way out.

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: No one wants to contemplate a penetration of the top echelon --- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: to hunt for such a traitor, is to hunt ourselves, which could cause much more damage than the mole ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Are you saying we cannot pursue this?

dialogues.speaker: GRENCHENKO, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I am saying that most are content to take the good lie over the bad truth.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Not me. Grenchenko eyes Egorov coldly, realizing what he's saying

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: If you do this and fail, nothing can protect you ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: And when I succeed?

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: A seat at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Bowie's "Quicksand" on a stereo in the next room. CLOSE ON A HUGE PIECE OF BLANK PHOTO PAPER in a tub of developer, under the hue of a red safety light. A black a white image materializing... We only catch a glimpse... PULL BACK TO a small home photo lab. TATIANA EGOROV, earl 20s, pixie hair, artist vibe, in jeans and t-shirt, looks on. A timer RINGS. She transfers the photo to a stop bath Appraising her work, she smiles excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom, wearing only panties, stands at the sink, washcloth soap in hand. The water is running. She stares at the bat lost in the trauma-trance of a bad memory.

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (0.S., IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Domi --- Come here! ... Domi --- Dom doesn't notice Tati come in and give her a worried lo Tati gives her big sister a deep hug from behind.  28.

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to show you something ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tati leads Dom into a spacious, Bohemian room, we see walls are covered with Tati's photos: of their family, th lives, and many of a younger Dom as a ballet dancer. Tati directs Dom to the photo drying on a line: a Diane A like portrait of a big old, rough-and-tumble Russian woma with no legs in a wheelchair, laughing so hard she's cryi Anxious about Dom's opinion, Tati lights a cigarette. Absolutely enthralled by the photo, Dom snaps out of her spell and we see her smile for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: It's wonderful ---

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: The depth and detail of the moment --- the joy triumphing over the tragedy --

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You're moved by anything broken or crippled ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: It's how we all truly are, isn't it? (teary look at Tati) I love it. One of your best. The sisters share a smile of gratitude and love for each other. Dom puts her arm around Tati, kisses her on the he A KNOCK ON THE DOOR. Tati flits over and looks through th peep hole, goes rigid. Turns to Dom.

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: It's Ivan. Dom frosts over. She turns the music off.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Say your hello and then leave. She disappears into the other room as Tati opens the door allowing a casually dressed Egorov inside, a leather foli under his arm. He gives her a hug and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Tati, how are you? You look well.  29.

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: As do you, Cousin. Egorov spots the hanging photo, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: This is for your next showing?

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You are so gifted. Egorov notices Dom return, now in clothes. He smiles warm at Tati and plucks the cigarette from her hand.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I just wish you would quit smoking. Your sister works too hard to ensure that you get the best care for a medical condition that is only exacerbated by cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Good. Tati throws Dom a worried glance and splits.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: What brings you here on a Sunday?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: A cup of tea would be nice. LATER: Dom is sitting at the table, poring over files fro the folio, while Egorov meanders around the apartment, perusing the pictures of Dom on the wall. He stops at a f photo, when Dom and Egorov are in their teens ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I miss the family summers at the lake in Kirzac. He turns to Dom with a subtle, carnal look.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Fond memories --- Dom knows that he's eyeing her, but she doesn't look up.  30.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Based on what you see, how would you appraise this man Nash?

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: He's a competent operator whose talent lies in making us believe he is incompetent. Egorov nods in agreement and takes a seat next to Dom.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: We have a penetration of the top- echelon, a mega-mole. And I suspect that Nash is the handler.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You're not Counter Intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: This would be a special project, outside of their purview.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: So they aren't pursuing him?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: They are focusing their attention on a technical breach. (Beat) Rumor has it Nash has been posted to Athens --- I'd like you to go there and make an appraisal. Patterns, pathology, vulnerabilities, leverage. Can he be approached? Manipulated? Is he still operational with his Moscow asset? (hard look) Get under his skin.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'm an operations officer ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: That was also trained as a Sparrow ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (nods, hateful contempt) Of course ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: The world makes whores of us all... (off her look) I'm only interested in the expedient result. How you choose to get it is entirely your discretion.  31.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You still have confidence in me after Brussels?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Absolutely. While you weren't successful in converting the target into an asset, the outcome was still extremely beneficial to us. Egorov packs up the files back into his folio.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You'll be naked. No diplomatic status, working without the knowledge of the Athens Rezident ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I don't know the city, the language. I can't operate without any support ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I've arranged resources and support through an illegal apparat. They are already looking for him. Egorov stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Do this and you have my word --- the Center will never put you on your back again. Crossing to the door, Egorov opens it, turns to Dom.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I can expect you at Yasenevo tonight? Dom nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tati's hanging on the front steps of a building with a GR OF FRIENDS. She's smoking, uptight, looking down the bloc She watches as Egorov exits her apartment building, gets his motorcycle and peels away. She starts to head back ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tati comes in, sees Dom packing clothes into a suitcase--

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: But you only just got back... (off Dom's silence) For how long this time?  32.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Please, Domi, don't go ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I have to.

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You know I can't discuss it ---

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Every time you go away, you come back with less of yourself --- (tears in her eyes) I'm always terrified --- that one day you'll come back and there'll be nothing left of you --- Pulling Tati into hug, Dom tries to restrain her own emot

dialogues.speaker: TATI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'd rather be sick and struggling than to live with this. Whatever it is you do, I don't want you doing it for me --- Dom abruptly breaks the embrace, forces Tati to look at h

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deck of a car ferry from Italy. Nate's kicking it on hood of his beat-up Lancia Fulvia $3, gazing out at the majestic Greek coast. A stunning day, everything wide ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate pulls his Lancia into the immigration station, on wh hangs a "Welcome to Greece!" sign in various languages. H parks, gets out and approaches the IMMIGRATION OFFICER in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lancia cruising a picturesque country road. Cresting hill, Nate pulls over, gets out and admires the view. A half mile ahead, the ancient ruins of CORINTH ignited b the setting sun and the sparkling Gulf of Corinth.  33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleepy fishing harbor. Nate ambles up to a quaint water cafe, scans the candlelit patio --- and then a loud WHIST Nate locks onto a stocky man getting up from his table wh another man is seated. Clearly drunk, the stocky guy lumb towards him, suddenly trips on a crack and falls into an empty table -- the man and table crashing to the ground. Nate comes over, grins down at MARTY GABLE, the CIA's Dep Chief of Station for Athens. In his late 40's, Gable's a grizzled chain-smoking, hard-drinking pit bull from the B

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Jesus, Gable. Thought you would've for sure taken a tit job on the 7th floor by now ---

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: And become a fucking cake eater? Never. Nate helps him up and they bear hug it out. Gable leads N back to where JAMES FORSYTH, the CIA's Chief of Station f Athens, is seated. Forsyth, 50s, is lace curtain Irish: s and tie, practical, intelligent. The men are done with di

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the Chief, Jim Forsyth

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: (shakes with Nate) Welcome to Greece. As they sit, Gable sees Forsyth appraising Nate.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I liked what I read in your hall- file. And Marty's obviously told me a lot about you. (Beat) Heard you had a rough ride out of Moscow.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: Benford called --- warned me against bringing you on.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Forget Benford. Guy's got no balls.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Tell me about it ---  34.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: No, literally, he has no balls --- got ‘em blown off in Korea. Never trust a cock who can't cum. Nate just shakes his head at Gable. Looks to Forsyth ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I appreciate the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: You heard what happened to us here in Athens back in December?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The Welch hit?

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Guy comes home from a movie with his wife -- the GODFATHER of all things -- and gets gunned down on his doorstep. A fucking Chief of Station!

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: First time in the history of the Company.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: (sneezes ) No love lost --- I hated Welch's guts. Best thing you can say about the prick was that he was cheap --- but that's besides the point.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: This is a street thing. Nobody greases one of our people, let alone a chief, and gets away with it ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I heard it was carried out by a radical lefty terrorist group ---

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Call themselves November 17th --- after the bloody uprising at Polytechnic University in '73 --- was sorta like this country's Kent State ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Students did the hit? Kids?  35.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: Yeah, students backed and trained by the Sovs --- they're using these kids as provocateurs.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: They're punks, but smart punks. Fuckers rob banks and move heroin to finance their operations ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So why haven't you rolled them up?

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: We've tried, but Moscow's got deep hooks into Greek intelligence. And it's been impossible to develop our own assets on the street.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Every one of our guys who's tried to work this scene has gotten made the second he walks in the door -- they're all too fucking square -- and these kids can smell that shit a mile away -- (grins at Nate) But you, you don't look or stink like a spook. Maybe they don't see you coming.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: We want you to stay away from the station, the embassy, DIP circuit --- Anyplace that any of us hang out at is out of bounds for you.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: All we want you to do is work these kids, develop us some assets.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm not a NOC.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: We're not asking you to be. You won't be on the DIP list, but we fixed it so you have immunity.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: Marty'll brief you on the rest of the details. Good luck. Forsyth gets up, shakes with Nate and walks out. Once he' gone. Gable wobbles to his feet, drops the bill on Nate.  36.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Pay the fucking bill and let's go ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gable throws a sympathetic arm around Nate as they stroll down a quiet street.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: So I guess Moscow really fucked you up in the head, huh?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It would anyone.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Feeling a little down and out? (off Nate's nod, thunders) Well if you're looking for sympathy, the only place you'll find it is in the dictionary, somewhere between shit and syphilis! Anyone who's worth anything has flamed out of station at one time or another. It's how you come back that makes you --- so get your head outta your ass and back into the game and ring the fucking gong on this thing.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Wow, that was some pep talk... Reaching his car, Gable takes out his keys, unlocks trunk

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Hey, all the reasons they hated you in Moscow is why we love you here. Make the most of it. Gable opens the trunk and Nate's stunned by what's inside

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The fuck is this!? CAMERA WHIP PANS WITH GABLE TO THE TRUNK revealing a SHOR FAT MAN whose arms, legs and mouth have all been duct-tap

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Mooky! Forgot all about you. The Man thrashes about, trying to yell through the tape - Gable punches him in the face.  37.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shut your dick-trap and relax. You'll get a chance to open it soon enough. Nate shaking his head at Gable in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Fucking Gable --- some people live and learn --- you just live. Gable grabs a gym bag out of the trunk, slams it shut and flashes Nate a sheepish grin and shrug.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: What else am I gonna do on a Saturday night? (hands Nate the bag) Everything you need to get started. Getting in behind the wheel, Gable starts the car and rol down his window.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're gonna love it here in Athens --- great food, a lotta action and dirt- cheap whores --- (cautionary fingerwag) Just don't ever go down on any of ‘em -- be like sucking cock by proxy. With that Gable tears out into the street, leaving Nate standing there with the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom steps off a plane, looking Bohemian chic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom hands a SWISS PASSPORT to an IMMIGRATION OFFICER -- n on it is DOMINIQUE JUNET. He thumbs through it. Stamps it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom drags her bags into a small but pretty apartment. She takes the place in and is pleased. She opens the doors to a small balcony, her eyes electric she takes in the spectacular view --- the hard white ligh the stark contrast of ruins amid the bustling metropolis, Lykavittos Hill and the Acropolis looming in the distance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom stands at a news kiosk across from the square, perusi the periodicals while keeping an eye on the swirl of traf  38. Glancing at the clock, 7:01 --- Dom heads to the curb and waves an approaching TAXI, it pulls over --- she gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom finds ELENA NIKOS sitting in the back. Elena, mid-30s is earthy, soulful-looking and 5 months pregnant. PAULOS, 20s, with a beard and long hair, is driving. Next to Paulos is GEORGE NIKOS, 50s, Elena’s swarthy pig a husband. He eyes Dom with a mix of desire and disdain - wanting to fuck her but not take orders from her.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: (French accent) Dominique.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Elena Nikos --- (indicating) My husband, George. Paulos --- Paulos pulls into traffic --- Dom vibing a whole lot of tension and suspicion in the car ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Your last communique indicated he arrived by ferry through Patras on the 12th ---

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yes, but we only found him three days ago.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: He's been here for almost 2 weeks --- what took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (angrily snapping) We covered the hotels, The American Club, safe-houses -- he hasn't been to the embassy -- has yet to be filed on the diplomatic list ---

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: But immigration registered his car, which we finally located in the Exarcheia district, where he's taken a room --- among the "ists".

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: "Ists"?  39.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Anarchists, student activists, revolutionists, communists, terrorists --- they all call the Exarcheia home.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Show me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi navigates the rough and tumble streets of Exarch the heart of the city's counter-culture scene. Anti- imperialist/anti-American graffiti and posters everywhere

dialogues.speaker: PAULOS
dialogues.text: He knows the language, is familiar with the city. He's posing as one of them, an "ist" --- spending his days at record and book shops, university campuses --- his nights at the clubs, galleries and cafes ---

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: There's only one reason why a CIA would settle here. He's talent spotting. Hunting for an access agent. (scoffs) A fool's errand. The people here distrust Americans almost as much as they despise fascists. No one will go anywhere near him... The taxi slows as they approach a tree-lined street of dilapidated apartment buildings.

dialogues.speaker: PAULOS
dialogues.text: He's in the pink building. Dom looks out at a three-story pink Neo-Classical buildin as they pass by Nate's street.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So what is this to be, a honeytrap? Dom shoots him a severe look.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well this is what you are, yes?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: George --- stop it. George throws a menacing look at Elena to keep her mouth shut, then turns back to Dom.  40.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: The Center activated us outside the normal channel, ordered us to operate without the knowledge of either our Line N control or the Rezident. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: It's not for you to question these directives, only to follow them.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Do you really think I've survived this long by blindly following any order given to me?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: No. You've survived this long because we've allowed you to. Remember that. (turns to Elena) We'll start with patterns, proclivities, movement analysis. And we'll need a location to work from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turning pages of a dossier chronicling Egorov's famil career ascent in the KGB -- assassinations, torture, sabo etc. News clippings and photos painting a disturbing port

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korch sits at his desk, smoking, flipping through this th file, uptight. He rests his cigarette in an ashtray. He shuts the file, lights another cig, but realizes he st has a lit one in the tray. He stomps one out. Korch paces anxiously. Finally he grabs one of the 8 phones on his de

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'd like him in my office, now. Yes. Where is he? No --- I'll go myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small auditorium with windows overlooking Khondia airfi An imposing COLONEL stands in front of a film screen addressing THIRTY EIGHT young, freshly-minted GRU OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Look out the window. The smokestack, you all know what it means. The young officers look to the lone building with a large brick smokestack on top, the tinge of fear in their eyes.  41.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: It's a ruble to get into the GRU --- it is two to get out. This is something you must never forget. The Colonel pushes a button on a console, black out curta cover the windows, the room goes dark -- a scratched, bla white film plays with no sound: a MIDDLE-AGED MAN, terrif secured to a stretcher --- this man is COLONEL OLEG PENKO

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Penkovsky forgot. Penkovsky thought he was smarter than us. But we caught him just as we do all traitors. And if you betray us, you will end as he does --- on the conveyer belt. Penkovsky is positioned feet first on a conveyer belt tha feeds into a roaring furnace. The belt is switched on and starts inching towards his fate -- silently SHRIEKING, brutally SLAMMING HIS HEAD BACK -- straining with every m to escape, TEARING HIS OWN TENDONS, BURSTING BLOOD VESSEL nose bleeds -- Penkovsky's feet slide into the flames. As the officers in the room watch in horror, Korch watche with a fatalistic resignation. The Colonel strides around the room to Korch, salutes and then cuts a smile.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You still love scaring the shit out them, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: They'll remember this more than the words. (Beat) What brings you down here?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I need a recommendation --- for a discreet trace and surveil ---

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Athens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate sweating his balls off in brutal heat as he makes hi way through the down and dirty streets of the Exarcheia - a watermelon in one arm and a grocery bag in the other.  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate turns onto his block. People are hanging out on thei stoops in the tree-shade, trying to beat the heat. He crosses to the steps of his building. The old SUPER an his BUDDY sit under a tree by the stoop playing backgammo Kicking it on the steps is LUKA KOSTAS --- early-20s, gro student/artist vibe. He's sketching something on a pad. Hiking up the stoop Nate collapses onto the step above Lu who hardly acknowledges him, and catches his breath...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Jesus. City's like a oven. Had no idea Athens got so fuckin' hot --- Nate peeks over Luka's shoulder, sees he's sketching the face of a stunning brunette. Luka ignores him. Looking ac the street, Nate sees the brunette, ALEXA, on her buildin steps gossiping with her college friends ZOE and THYIA, a free love flower girls.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At it again, huh? One of these days you should really just talk to her --- Annoyed, Luka glances back at Nate and closes his book.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, if it scares you, it might be a good thing to try. Luka takes out a joint, sparks up. The Super yells at him Greek to stop -- Luka just takes another hit. He can see Nate eyeing the joint longingly with a grin but ignores h

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. Then you don't get any of my watermelon. Nate cuts a piece of watermelon. Slurps as he eats it -- trying to annoy Luka --- and it's working.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what're you up to tonight? (off Luka's silence) That's cool. Me? I'm gonna go to the movies by myself, have dinner with nobody, maybe get a drink alone. Then come home and beat off --- only question is --- (eyes wandering) Who am I'm gonna beat it out to? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (locks onto Alexa, grins) Hey, you don't mind if I borrow one of those drawings of yours, do you? Luka knows Nate's trying to tune him up, won't take the b

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This fucking heat is unbearable.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Maybe you should go back to America ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (hard look Luka) I would if I could --- Nate see this piques Luka's interest. But Nate's attentio is drawn across the street. A light bulb goes off. He hea to his car, pops the trunk, rifles around, pulls out a wr Nate struts past the curious girls, stops at a fire hydra and tightens the wrench around its bolt.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER, (IN GREEK)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You can't do that. Heaving on the wrench with all his strength, he emits wil primal GRUNTS. Everyone eyes him like he's crazy. The bol gives. A geyser ROCKETS UP. Nate basks under the downpour The KIDS are the first to join him, then the girls and fi people from all over the block. Nate returns to the stoop, soaked, a shit-eating grin, si next to Luka, who's not giving Nate anything.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You know something, chico, you'd probably like me if you had the balls. A soaking wet Alexa and the voluptuous Thyia skip over an greet Nate and Luka with smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hey yourself.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: Thanks for doing this. It's wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Don't thank me --- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (gestures to Luka) It was Luka's idea.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: So why are you still sitting here? C'mon. Alexa and Thyia return to the water --- beckoning Luka an Nate to come. Luka gives Nate a grin, hands him the joint and joins them. Nate smiles as Luka gambols with the girls under the wate

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: POV CAMERA: Snapping shots of Nate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rundown, 5th floor apartment diagonal to Nate's buildin In T-shirt and shorts, a sweaty Dom stands behind a tripo mounted, long-lens camera aimed through a ragged hole in curtains, which are half-drawn in front of open balcony d Dom wears headphones connected to a sophisticated, tripod mounted shotgun/laser microphone aimed at Nate through an curtain hole. The Mic is also wired to a tape recorder. George watches Nate through binoculars, shirt open. Dom g him a look that says "Guess you were wrong."

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: So he's more original than most. We'll see how far he gets. On the wall behind Dom is a map of Athens with pins indic locations Nate has been --- and various surveillance phot Snapping a few shots, she steps away from the camera, mak notes on a pad of paper. George eyes her lecherously.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can see why they sent you. He steps towards her, swipes a finger down her arm to wip off some sweat. Dom just continues to jot notes.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: What about your wife? Your unborn child? George steps even closer.  45.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: The Center arranged our marriage. The baby isn't mine. He slides his hand over Dom's crotch. She looks at him, coolly, completely disconnected. He pathetically tries to arouse her, but it's not doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Are you done? Humiliated, George pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Bitch. Dom just returns her attention to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: The garbage in the kitchen's beginning to smell. Take it out. George grudgingly follows her order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luka, Alexa and four of her girlfriends from the stoop ar waiting outside. Luka yells up to a second floor apartmen

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Nate, come on.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (pops head out window) Yeah --- on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spartan studio flat with a kitchenette and bathroom. Na moves to the entry alcove. Places a small ball bearing al a groove in the floor, about 15 inches in front of the do Nate slips out the door without disturbing the ball beari

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is on a rooftop on the corner of Nate's block. Usi binoculars, he watches Nate, Luka and the girls turn onto bigger street, joining a flow of KIDS moving in the same direction. George calls into his walkie talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate, Luka and the girls are among the streams of people entering the campus of Athens Polytechnic University. Nat notices a lot of people carrying anti-American posters...  46.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Thought we were going to a concert.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Yes. The concert's after the rally. (off Nate's look) Don't worry, it's cool --- but if anyone asks, you're Canadian. CAMERA PANS to Paulos embedded in the throngs, watching N and the others enter the campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena puts down her radio, turns to Dom.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: They're at the Polytechnic rally, but Paulos has lost sight of them --- Dom grabs her purse and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom crosses the street and enters Nate's apartment buildi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom hears the TV in the Super's apartment. Removing her sandals, she creeps up the creaky steps to the 2nd floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving to Nate's door Dom pulls a small flashlight and magnifying glass from her purse, scans around the doorfra stops when she finds Nate's trip: a strand of hair stuck across the gap between the door and the frame. Dom pulls tape from her purse, tears a tiny strip, and pl it over the hair. She then retrieves lock picking tools, quickly picks the lock, nudges the door open and slips in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom steps into the middle of the flat, takes everything i Pulling out a Polaroid, Dom rotates as she photographs ev inch of the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate, Luka and the girls are among thousands of young peo crammed into the quad facing a stage with banners touting the rally sponsor: the Communist Youth of Greece or KNE. The young, passionate KNE LEADER on stage gives a fiery s riling the crowd up. A dormant ROCK BAND waits behind him  47.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What's he going off about?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: There is a big march on the American Embassy in a few weeks --- We want the U.S. military bases out of Greece --- A pack of 6 ANARCHIST THUGS, more hardcore than everyone else, aggressively pushes through the crowd. As they pass Luka recognizes the pack leader, CHRISTOS --- Nate clearl recognizes him too.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christos! Luka reaches out to grab Christos in a friendly way, but gets shoved back so hard by one of the Thugs that he fall on his ass. Nate jumps in and DECKS the guy --- Four of the other Thugs move on Nate and a brawl erupts. Nate, screwheaded gleam in his eyes, enjoys scrapping it Luka and Christos break it up. Luka pulls Nate away, Chri pulls his guys back while Nate and the Thug he suckerpunc shout at each other ---

dialogues.speaker: LUKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's okay, it's okay, he's with my cousin. He just doesn't know me.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Your cousin?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Just wait here. Don't do anything. Nate watches Luka cross over to Christos and they hug it out. Alexa and the girls approach Nate, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm fine, I'm fine. Christos eyes Nate while having a heated discussion with Luka about him. His Thugs throwing dangerous glares. Christos and Luka share a soul brother handshake and Chri and his crew disappear into the crowd. Luka returns to Na fear in his eyes, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? The guy tossed you on your ass, I was just trying to help.  48.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: I appreciate that, but you have no idea who you just messed with ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
