dialogues.text: Yeah? So then tell me --- what's their deal?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Let's just forget about it, okay? It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KITCHEN: icebox, shelves, drawers, etc. Under the sink Do finds serious water damage from leaky old pipes. CLOSET: Dom spritzes NPPD spydust on Nate's clothing and BATHROOM: Dom checks toilet, sink. For loose tiles. In Na Dopp kit: condoms, bottles of Dexedrine, Valium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, The KNE LEADER wraps up his speech, militantly waving his fist and chanting in Greek "OUT WITH THE USA!! The crowd joins in, fists in the air. A MILITANT unfurls an AMERICAN FLAG on stage. The KNE Lea sets it ablaze -- the crowd ROARS in approval just as the band erupts into a Greek cover of Zeppelin's "Dancing Day The frenzied place goes insane, dancing, jumping, screami Nate takes in the scene: dazed, confused and disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEDROOM: Dom looks through Nate's backpack. Nothing worth About to return it, she feels the thickness of the should straps, inspects them. Finds a hidden seam, carefully ope it and stashed in the padding is a wad of cash and Nate's diplomatic passport. In the other strap, another wad of c and a mugshot, of Luka's cousin, CHRISTOS. BEDSTAND AREA: A European Playboy on top of a stack of bo She photographs each before flipping through them, increasingly surprised. She photographs the last book, Pa Markova's poems, in Russian. She looks at it curiously, b doesn't recognize it. Dom reaches into her purse for her radio. Calls in.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Status?  49.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (OVER RADIO)
dialogues.text: It's over, but Paulos still doesn't have him but ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Understood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luka, Alexa and the girls all chat as they meander throug the neighborhood. Thyia notices Nate off to the side, qui

dialogues.speaker: THYIA
dialogues.text: We don't hate America, just your government ---

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: And who can blame us? Greece is the birthplace of democracy --- and what does your government do? They undermined Papandreou and supported the junta -- fucking fascists! Do you have any idea how many people were killed and tortured under the reign of the Colonels?

dialogues.speaker: THYIA
dialogues.text: And still your government continues: in Chile, Iran, Vietnam, Cambodia ---

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: Please, enough of the politics! Can we all just go and do something fun?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Let's go watch the sunrise at Anavissos.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We can take my car. Just need to stop and grab my keys. Excited, the girls hurry ahead chatting. Luka hangs back, putting an apologetic hand on Nate's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Sorry, man --- I just ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It's cool, I get it. Why do you think I left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom checks the flat against her Polaroids. Satisfied, she puts them in her purse and moves to the entry alcove.  50. She swings open the door -- and knocks the ball bearing i motion. Dom hears it ROLLING. Seeing the tiny ball, she s with the dreaded realization that she just hit a second t Closing the door, she picks up the ball, tries to figure where it was placed, but there's no way to know. She's fu Suddenly struck by an idea -- Dom moves to the kitchen ar and kneels under the sink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking far down the cross street, George spots Nate and group approaching, calls into his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dom hurries down the stairs, she can hear the Super in his apartment excitedly stomping about CURSING to himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching Dom leave Nate's, cross the street and disappear down the block. CAMERA POV PANS down block, locks onto the shapes of Nate and gang as they turn onto street and head towards us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena peering into camera. Dom rushes in, Elena looks up

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: What took you --- !?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: There was a ball bearing --- Elena doesn't understand. Dom dashes over to the shotgun in her rush to grab the headphones, she accidentally knoc over the mic tripod. As she scrambles to pick it up ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He set a second trip on the inside of the door -- I didn't see it ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Luka walk to his flat. Noticing the hair is gone Nate subtly tenses up. He puts his key into the lock, rea the door's already open... The men share a look as they e In the alcove they see water on the floor -- hear GRUNTS tools scraping. Stepping into the flat they find more wat and the Super under the sink trying to clamp a leaking pi  51.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom holds the mic like a gun, aiming the scope through th curtain hole on Nate's apartment window. Elena's right ne to her with the headphones so they can both listen...

dialogues.speaker: SUPER, (OVER HEADPHONES)
dialogues.text: Pipes leak again! Water comes through my ceiling --- now please, help --- hold this tight so I can stop --- Elena takes a breath of relief. Dom lowers the mic, sets tripod back on its legs. Although a crisis was averted -- Dom's still coiled with acute tension, furious with herse

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Quick thinking ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I was lucky ---

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Luck is the residue of skill, experience. I never would have thought of this ruse ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I never should have missed it ---

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You are being too hard on yourself ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: If I'm not, they will be. Elena is struck by the intensity of Dom's self-rage and f Dom quickly collects herself, grabs her purse, takes out stack of Polaroids --- lays out a photo of Christos's mug

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does he look familiar?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: His name is Christos Kostas. He has been involved in several para-militant groups in Athens. Last I heard, he was aligned with November 17th ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weary Korch sits alone finishing dinner. He sees Sokolo the First Deputy Chief of the GRU from the earlier meetin carrying a tray, looking like a condemned man.  52. Gesturing Sokolov to sit, Korch eyes him with concern.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: How goes the hunt?

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I'm a blind man in a dark room looking for a black hat that isn't there. (off Korch's look) We're going through everything, sweeping every trunk line, flushing the system with snares -- and nothing. (leans in, grave) I'm beginning to fear we might have to confront the reality of a mole.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Any way I can help?

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Not with this, but there is something --- you've heard of the walk-in in Istanbul?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: The German engineer. I hear the taste of intel he gave us is impressive.

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Beyond impressive. Unprecedented. But his list of demands before he discloses anything else is preposterous. They get greedier and greedier every time.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Better than a shit-eater volunteering to help us for free, no? Sokolov manages a derisive smile.

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Kaminsky was supposed to fly there and vet him, but his ulcer is bleeding again. Could you do it?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm overwhelmed right now too. When?

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: It was supposed to be in 10 days, but we can try to work it around your schedule.  53.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning traffic swirls in front of the KGB's neo-baroque headquarters. EGOROV on his motorcycle zips past the line Lada limos entering the secure parking --- and heads down the street to a nondescript KGB administrative building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a large pastry box in hand, Egorov heads down a basement hall to a secure door. He types in a code to the keypad lock --- the door buzzes open and he enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mole hunt command center is a large, open room clutte with desks, file cabinets, and cots. The walls are covere with various investigative matrixes, link diagrams, etc. wall is dedicated to the eight remaining suspects with th photo at the top of a long column of key biographical dat Egorov's 2nd in command, LIEUTENANT BORIS KOSOLOV directs team of FIVE WEARY YOUNG ANALYSTS evaluating reams of dat Giving the pastries to his team, Egorov looks to Kosolov.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: So --- Nicoleyevsky?

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: But he held so much promise. Motive, access, the hubris.

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: But not the opportunity. We finished reconciling his movements with the timeline --- too many discrepancies. It's not him. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Don't be. Elimination is still progress. Take him off the board. Kosolov nods to one of the Analysts nearby.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Anything come in on the wire?

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Early this morning...  54. Egorov unlocks the door and enters his office --- The Analysts take Nicoleyevsky's photo and info off the b Two columns over is KORCHNOI's photo and profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, spartan space. Egorov moves to a hulking computer/telex terminal with a flashing indicator. He tak a key from around his neck, inserts it and turns. Types i command. The printer starts chugging out a message. Ripping it off the printer Egorov sits at his immaculate desk and after reading it carefully, makes some notes. He waves the waiting Kosolov into his office.

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Word from Athens? Egorov slides him the Telex printout. Kosolov reads it.

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: The collected poems of Pavel Markova. And in Russian no less. Interesting. (off Egorov's look) His volumes are impossible to find in Moscow. Most were purged.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: That's hardly the meat of it --- (snatches telex back) But the fact that Nash is focusing on these useful idiots, November 17, could be advantageous.

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: If she is unable to get what we need her way, this gives us the cover for another option. Surprised, Kosolov throws him a grave look, are you serio

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: A deadly disease sometimes requires a dangerous remedy. (Beat) But it'll never come to that.

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You're putting a lot of faith in her. Why? Egorov stares into the burning light bulb on his lamp. Af a long, unwholesome beat --  55.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Because I truly understand what she's capable of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the imposing shadow of the Acropolis, The Plaka is maze of cobblestone streets lined with patinated neo-clas buildings, a quaint, stunning Bohemian wonderland. Casually elegant in a simple, sexy white kaftan, African beads and sandals, Dom strides towards the gates of a crumbling, walled-in mansion under renovation. A sign out reads: TAKIS GALLERY - KASTIMBALIS - FIXED METAMORPHICS. Some PEOPLE are hanging outside while others flow in and of the front gates. A friendly, laid-back vibe. The exoti jazzy Ethiopian grooves of Mulatu Astake emanating from t courtyard inside. Dom steps through the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ruinous courtyard packed with the Athens's Bohemian jet set, everyone circulating amongst the hulking, dramatical lit sculptures, primitive moderns hewn out of basalt. Dom takes in the scene then slowly moves clockwise around the courtyard's edges -- casually scouting for Nate. She spots him hanging with Luka, Alexa, Zoe and Thyia. Moving closer, Dom peruses the sculptures while stealing glances at Nate, observing him having a great time. Easy see his group's blithe and vibrant camaraderie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dim, dead-end corridor, Nate rolls up behind a flirting COUPLE waiting by a closed door. Finally a man comes out the couple goes in. Nate's annoyed, really needs to piss. Dom suddenly appears, getting in line behind Nate. Althou he tries to play it cool, he's clearly struck by her beau and vibe. He gives her an easy "what's up" nod. She nods back. After a beat, something catches Nate's eye -- a small, ba noticeable sentence, hand-scrawled in Greek along the wal in front of them. Nate breaks out in a luminous smile --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: That's fucking inspired --- (gestures to graffiti) You see this?

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (FRENCH ACCENT)
dialogues.text: What does it say?  56.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: "You may paint over me, but I will still be here." And suddenly we HEAR the carnal giggles, moans and grunts the couple going at it in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Christ, you gotta be kidding me... Annoyed and desperate, Nate raps on the door. The couple inside yells a "FUCK OFF" in Greek, resumes their stride.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They gotta have another restroom upstairs -- right? UPSTAIRS - MINUTE LATER: Dom and Nate search the darkness the mansion's 2nd floor which is gutted and in shambles. stumbles over some debris and Nate smoothly steadies her.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm Nate --

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Dominique -- They finally locate a pitch-dark bathroom with a door tha won't stay open. Feeling just inside, Nate finds and flic on a light switch, illuminating a single bulb -- but the switch is broken and won't stay on unless held.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'll hold it for you, you for me. K? Dom heads in while Nate holds the light on. He whistles t give her some cover as she tinkles --- DOM AND NATE COMING DOWN STAIRS - MINUTES LATER: Nate squ off and locks eyes with Dom when they reach the bottom -- she catches the subtle smirk beneath Nate's lips.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (FRENCH ACCENT)
dialogues.text: Amused?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And you're not? Nate's smirk opens up into a charmingly goofy but direct smile --- she holds his gaze without returning the smile.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be patient -- eventually I'1l do or say something interesting ---  57.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: (after a beat of waiting) Thanks for the help.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Sure thing. As Dom moves back into the packed courtyard, Nate tilts h head to admire the swing of her ass ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerging from the gates, Dom cuts through the throng of p hanging in front of the gallery, heads down the street al

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dominique --- hey... Dom turns, sees Nate, Luka and the girls among the crowd Nate comes over.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're all going to this place right near here -- best barbounia you've ever had -- you should come with us.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Thank you, but ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Come on, it'll be fun -- trust me --

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I don't even know you ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We just listened to each other pee, we're practically married. MUSIC and LAUGHTER carry us into ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taverna in the Plaka's old quarter. Dom, Nate, Luka and girls sit at an outside table --- eating, drinking, laugh getting hammered on Ouzo as they play 2 truths and a lie. Across the street, an OLDER WOMAN in a wheelchair playing accordion and a TEENAGE BOY on violin provide the soundtr

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: I always flirt with Priests. I was a very fat child. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When performing fellatio on a man, I sometimes think what it would be like to bite off his penis. Nate and Luka exchange a look. Giggling, everyone debates which statement was the lie --- and then come to a consen

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: There is no way that you were fat ---

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: No --- it's the truth ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Watch out, brother --- Everyone but Alexa takes a shot.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: Dominique --- your turn...

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Let me think for a moment.. (beat) I am not wearing any panties. I once killed someone with my bare hands. (subtle smirk at Nate) And I enjoy urinating in front of strange men.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I knew it. The table giggles...

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Kill a person! Ha! Too easy. Drink. Dom does her shot... And the whole table looks to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Okay -- okay. (gathering his thoughts) All right, I masturbate at least twice a day. I enjoy watching strange women pee. I worship Satan. The table cracks up and confers, struggling for consensus

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: You don't masturbate twice a day ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Are you for real? You guys really think I'm a Satan worshiper?  59.

dialogues.speaker: THYIA
dialogues.text: How are we to know different, mystery man? You tell us nothing of yourself ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You guys are assholes --- now drink --- Everyone laughs and drinks --- LATER: the buzzed group leaving the taverna in high-spiri

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: A party at the Atticus --- (takes Dom's left arm) And you are coming with us... Nate stops to toss the musicians money -- and suddenly fr the tree above, A BIRD TAKES A HUGE SHIT ALL OVER HIM. Th wheelchair woman EXPLODES with wild raucous laughter and Luka and the girls quickly join in --- then Nate... Pierced by the image of the wheelchair woman in hysterics Dom looks at everyone else laughing --- and then somethin happens --- she just lets herself go, and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ruins of an ancient amphitheater at the base of the Acropolis have been converted into a 1970s rave -- HUNDRE OF BAREFOOTED YOUNG PEOPLE dancing wildly on stage or alo the tiered benches to Roxy Music's "Both Ends Burning". Amid the pulsing, sweaty crowd, Nate, Luka and the girls loose -- as Dom moves with them, something powerful is be unleashed inside her -- a joyous, vital force -- that is taking her out of her mind and into her body. And the dee she goes, the more amazing her dancing becomes... LITTLE LATER: Everyone funking out to Sly and the Family Stone's "Loose Booty" --- but Dom's on another level -- flowing with a hypnotic, unbridled expressiveness and pow that electrifies everyone around her, especially Nate. LITTLE LATER: Blown out, Nate and Luka emerge from the da mass, climb high up on the tiered benches and look down a the girls grooving to T-REX's "20th Century Boy".

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: (gesturing to Dom) She's cool... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LUKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (off Nate's nod) She told Zoe she lives in Geneva --- just here for the summer, borrowing a friend's flat ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I caught that...

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We'll see. Luka sparks a joint, tokes, and passes to Nate, who takes hit and looks around, taking everything in --- and catche something in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, isn't that one of the fucksticks I scrapped it up with at the rally, that was rolling with your cousin?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (gestures) Right there. You see him? With the white shirt.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: No, you need to get your eyes checked.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Those guys would never come to a party like this.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You ever gonna tell me what the deal with them is? Is this guy Christos a distant cousin?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: No, he's my dad's brother's son. We were raised together after The Colonels killed my uncle in prison.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So he's more like a brother?  61.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: He used to be. He's just really angry now. Even though I understand why, I don't like being around it. Nate passes the joint back to Luka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted but happy, the group shambles down a larger roa towards the Plaka.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: You know what we should all do next weekend? Go to Tryphosa.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: (excitedly hugs Luka) Yes! Yes! We must!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What's Tryphosa?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: A paradise for artists, dreamers --- trust me, you will love it...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm sold. Nate tries to wave down an approaching taxi but to no ava The group walks ahead, giving Nate and Dom space. They la behind, quiet, side by side --- a palpable, unusual attra between them. After a long beat ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watching you let loose was really something else --- like you were in an ecstatic trance -- I saw flashes of Duncan -- Mary Wigman -- Graham... Dom glares at Nate, trying to restrain her astonishment..

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: So you follow dance?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I follow the dancers. They exchange a smile as another taxi appears --- Nate wa and it stops. The girls smother Dom with hugs and kisses, saying how mu fun they had, they need to hang out. Nate sees them excha phone numbers. Then the group gives Dom and Nate some spa  62. A crazy tension --- Dom off-balance, genuinely vulnerable Nate's easy -- he opens the Taxi door for her.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: This was fun ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: See what happens when you trust the timing of your life? (potent stare) You're pretty fucking great --- keep that shit up. Nate breaks the tension by gently easing Dom into the tax and closing the door --- Watching the taxi head down the street and disappear arou a corner, Nate smiles inwardly as he heads back to the ot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom's rattled with conflicting emotion, struggling to get control of herself. She looks at her trembling hands, unn by her reaction, thinking, "what's wrong with me?"

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gable's car parked on a nondescript street. Nate sits nex to Gable, who's chain-smoking.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Nothing. I'm just saying --- Luka is a good kid, Marty. Clean. No involvement with his cousin or N17 whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: I want Christos --- everything else is pickles and tits. So get with the program, unless you wanna be sent back to shitsville U.S.A., a fucking floorwalker.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: If you just give me some more time, I'll figure out another way to get to him.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: No, I'm not gonna risking it -- you have the perfect setup. You go away to this hippie island. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have a great time. Fuck, suck, play. Prime him. When you get back, you put him in the harness and we start to drill down on his cunt cousin. Gable reaches into a secret compartment under his seat an pulls out a small, cellophane-wrapped brick of heroin.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: The fuck do you think? Blue Orchid, same kind of junk N17 is moving. Before you leave for your trip, you stash this in the kid's apartment. Nate takes the drugs. Gable writes a number on a piece of paper, hands it to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the number for Captain Harry Haridopolos, our guy in the Athens PD. Call him, tell him you're a friend of Mister Fenwick. He'll understand. Set up the bust for when you get back. Nate shakes his head over how fucked up it is.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It's not right putting him into play -- it's gonna ruin his life.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Kid's going in the system, Nate. You either run him, or someone else will.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (mordant ) My rabbi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The half-light of dusk. Miles Davis' "Sketches of Spain" churning quietly on the tape deck. Elena's sitting at the table knitting a baby blanket. She watches Dom move throu a series of ballet stretches. Exhausted, Dom gets up, checks camera, then her watch. Si at the table, she drinks some water.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I envy your flexibility. How long did you train as a dancer?  64.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Ever since I can remember.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Life. Elena stops knitting, keels forward a bit.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you allright? Elena takes Dom's hand and puts it on her stomach to feel the baby kicking. A deep moment. Dom's face softens.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: We are the only ones who can truly feel the future, because we give birth to it, yes?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Where's the father?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Beirut, last I heard. (wistful smile) Hard to resist a bad boy that's a good man. (Beat) I assumed that were a sparrow --- but you're an operations officer, aren't you? Dom removes her hand from Elena's tummy and after a hesit beat, nods. Elena smiles, stunned and impressed.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, I wasn't pressed into service. I do it because I have faith in the Marxist ideal. I've always believed in the cause despite feeling that the cause never truly believed in me --- (proud look at Dom) Until this moment, I never thought they would see us as something more than just a wife, secretary or whore ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: They don't, not really ---

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: What does the Center want from Nash? What is your objective?  65.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: (after tense beat) They want me to seduce him --- extract information --- (looks away, ashamed) They don't think I am capable of doing this any other way. Elena gently forces Dom to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Then you must prove them wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate moves through the Monastiraki flea market, crosses a street and enters a cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate's at a pay phone next to the bathroom. He dials the number off of the piece of paper Gable gave him.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Harry Haridopolos. I'm a friend of Mister Fenwick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Luka wait in Nate's car. Luka checks his watch, leans across Nate and HONKS the horn. Alexa runs out from her apartment and gets in the car with her bags.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Where are Zoe and Thyia?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: They are not coming. Zoe's got a allergy rash. Thyia met a boy ---

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: And they're just telling us now!?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hey, it's cool, you guys should just go, you can take my car to the port ---

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: No no no, you must come --- Luka cuts Alexa off with a glare.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: He's coming --- let's go. Nate starts driving.  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ferry heading out of port. The trio cuts through the pa lounge, scanning for seats. Finding a spot on the floor, they start making camp. Alexa suddenly spots something, smiles and starts waving, trying to get someone's attention. Nate turns around and sees Dom in the crowd. He's stunned, caught totally off g

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Holy shit... Alexa flashes Nate a little "surprise!" Look --- and then she and Luka greet Dom with an excited kiss and hug.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: I'm so happy Alexa convinced you to join our pilgrimage!

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Thank you for the invite... (soft smile at Nate) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hey. An awkward beat of tension between Nate and Dom.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They didn't tell me you were coming ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Oh. Well I hope it's okay --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, no, it's good you're getting lost with us ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Where are Zoe and Thyia?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: They canceled at the last minute. Another uncomfortable beat of inaction. Sensing the uneasiness, Luka pulls everyone into a group hug.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Come on guys! This is going to be our great adventure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sweltering, overcast day...  67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KORCH'S ASSISTANT types at his desk. Across from him is a DIPLOMATIC COURIER, an armored briefcase handcuffed to hi wrist. An ARMED ESCORT waits next to the Courier. Korch rumbles in and everyone stands at attention, salute

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: DIPLOMATIC COURIER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: From the Athens diplomatic pouch, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated at his desk, Korch dials the combos to the case's locks, opens it. Inside is a security envelope with wax s He opens it, pulls out a typed report and photos -- all o which are stamped on the back with a unique code. Korch reads the report, then peruses the pictures -- he s on one photo, grabs a magnifying glass, and inspects the image -- his interest suddenly shifts to concern. Korch quickly moves to his safe -- unlocks it, grabs Egor dossier -- slaps on his desk, rifles through it until he finds what he's looking for. Korch sits back disturbed, unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE OVER a small, colorful fishing boat chugging a the brilliant Sea of Crete, parallel to a remote island, epic coastline of volcanic rock. Perfect day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat's deck is jammed with supplies. Luka and Alexa a half-asleep. Dom sits nearby, looking over at --- Nate kicking it with STAVROS, 60s, a village fisherman-tu hippie, whistling as he steers. Nate joins the whistling. They round a bend. A mile ahead, a COLOSSAL WHITE PUMICE ROCK FORMATION juts out of the coast, the size of a six s building, blocking the land behind it. Stavros nods to it

dialogues.speaker: STAVROS
dialogues.text: Tryphosa. Luka and Alexa wake. They all move to the bow, gaze at th rock. Dom squints, shading her eyes from the sun, so Nate puts his bucket hat on her. She thanks him with a look.  68. They spot the silhouettes of PEOPLE on top of the rock standing up, waving at them. As they finally come around the rock, Tryphosa is reveale A natural, horseshoe-shaped harbor framing a perfect beac Abutting one end of the beach, the massive rock face is honeycombed by a matrix caves converted into into hippie dwellings, squatters emerging from them like a motel. Behind the beach is a tiny village of flagstone streets a white-washed, minimal houses nestled along the slopes. Bordering the other side of the beach is another, taller white rock formation. On top of it are TEMPLE RUINS. At t base of this formation is a natural quay and a plane of s rock jutting into the water, with SUNBATHERS laying on it MAMA'S TAVERNA edges the beach. Painted across the tavern wall in massive, hippie flower children font is the phras “TODAY IS LIFE, TOMORROW NEVER COMES." The group is awestruck. Luka grabs the girls' hands on ei side of him and Alexa grabs Nate's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hauling their gear, the group follows MAMA, 50s, the big Greek matriarch of Tryphosa, up a flagstone street throug this hippie commune paradise.

dialogues.speaker: MAMA, (IN GREEK)
dialogues.text: There are 2 wash-houses, one by the beach, one right there in the village --- They pass a small market with curtains of tomatoes, squid drying on clothes lines, etc...

dialogues.speaker: MAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, and there is only 1 telephone in the Taverna in case of emergency... They approach the teal blue door of one of the white PRIM VILLAS cut into the rock overlooking the beach and water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama leads them into the primitive villa's main room: A t four chairs, cushions on the floor. A kitchen area with a water basin, a wood-burning stove. There are 2 bedrooms - and a veranda with a hammock strung up -- a stunning view

dialogues.speaker: MAMA, (IN GREEK)
dialogues.text: The communal dinners are down on the beach at 9 --- all that we ask is that you bring an offering.  69. And with that Mama leaves. The group walks out onto the veranda and takes in the view. Dom gazes at the caves, st by the magic of this place.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: The Romans used those caves as catacombs --- Nate gestures to the ruins atop the other rock formation.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: And those ruins?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: I don't know --- They all exchange a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throngs of Hippies hanging out on the otherworldly rocks tabled high over the water. Dom and Alexa lay topless on towels, eyes closed. Alice Coltrane's "Blue Nile" wafting from Dom's tape deck. Nate and Luka are playing backgammon next to them. Nate i having trouble focusing on the game -- struggling to not check Dom out. Nate can see Luka is very amused by all th

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: If it scares you, it might be a good thing to try.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Asshole...

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's cool off. Luka and Nate jump off the 20 foot cliff into the water. Treading water, the two take in the surrounding beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet residential street of apartment buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korch's modest one-bedroom apartment. A shelf with a reco player and stacks of records. A console table lined with PHOTOS OF KORCH -- his childhood; one with his father; mo with his gorgeous wife, a shrine to their love. Korch is sitting at his kitchen table with a transistor r that's been cracked open revealing an empty hiding spot.  70. He's hunched over the "BUSTER" covcomm device Nate gave h earlier -- fingers typing a message on the minuscule keyb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed for an afternoon in the park, Korch gets on a bus with a small chess set in hand, a bag of fruit and the transistor radio. Though he has sunglasses on, he's clear in hyper-aware SDR mode, clocking everything around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korch sits down at a table in an area where chess matches are being played. He sets up his pieces, puts his radio n to the board and extends the antenna --- He presses down hard on the ON switch, sending the burst transmission, then switches the radio on --- he futzes wi it while looking at a green indicator --- after a few sec the light goes on. Korch relaxes a little bit as a MAN approaches to challenge him to a game. THE CAMERA RISES ABOVE THE CANOPY OF THE PARK revealing t American Embassy is a few blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The communal dinner. 35 people sitting around a table of offerings and jugs of wine, talking, laughing, eating. While chatting with a CHUBBY GUY, Nate catches Dom steali a glance at him amidst her own conversation. They lock ey Nate flashes a little grin, she smiles back. An amused Luka nudges Nate to turn around -- they watch t YOUNG HIPPIES performing a ritual while lighting the bonf

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Oh shit. I just thought of something. I think I forgot to turn the hot plate off in my place. Antony, the super, do you know his number?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Could you call Thyia or Zoe and see if one of them could go over and turn it off? I don't want to burn the building down.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, I'll call tonight.  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonfire's crackling. A couple of GUITARISTS strumming alo Jugs of wine and joints making the rounds. Dom's talking with an OLD HIPPIE as he gestures to the ru atop the colossal rock. Finally his GIRL pulls him away. Dom looks around -- no sign of Luka or Alexa. She turns, sees Nate walking down the beach along the waterline. Cat up to him, they move together, not saying anything. Final Dom gestures to the ruins.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I found out what the ruins are ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: It's a dream temple, a sanctuary for those seeking healing, a relief from a pain of the soul. The ancient Greeks called it an Asclepieion. Nate stops and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Come on, for real --- ?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Yes. The temple's priests would heal people using a dream therapy. Dom heads up into the village. Nate following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom wind up towards their villa. Behind them are the moonlit ruins atop the rock...

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: The ritual began with 2 days of purifying sweat chambers and baths --- after which the priests would massage sacred oils into your body -- preparing you for your entry into the dream incubation chamber ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (repeats it dreamily) Dream incubation chamber... Far out.  72.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Once in the chamber, you would be lulled into a deep sleep by soft chanting -- and it is in your dreams that your soul would be cured of its woes. The priests would interpret your dream and extract its divine prescription for how to live your life -- and if you followed it, you would be made whole again. Dom and Nate reach their villa. Nate looks back at the ru

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We should climb up there, check it out ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I'd like that. Dom and Nate share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom enter the dark, empty villa. Nate lights a candle. They stare at each other in the glow. Tension so primal, so achingly intense, too strong to resist... Unti

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Good night, Nate.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay... Dom shuts herself in her room. Nate exhales like, "Fuuuck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate swinging in the hammock, mind racing, gazing into th night. The bonfire's dying, the beach party winding down. Luka and Alexa come onto the veranda, both profoundly wor

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What's up, guys? (off their silence) My hot plate, did you reach Zoe or Thyia? Nate sees they're freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? The place burn down?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: I'm in big trouble, Nate ---  73.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: We spoke to Zoe. The Police were in his flat, they're looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom steps out of her room with a cup of water. She stops when she hears Nate, Luka and Alexa talking outside --

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Funny.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're not joking. Zoe says they found heroin.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Heroin?! Fucking heroin? Dom steps closer to eavesdrop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate's out of the hammock now.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: I swear to you I have no idea what's going on right now. I've never gone near the drug.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So, what? You're saying the police planted it in your apartment?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: No, Antony was with them the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, how the fuck did it get there, Luka? Magic?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: (frantic) I don't know, I don't know. It's not mine.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It's okay, I believe you. We just gotta think this through. Nate starts pacing around.  74.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know anyone that you've been with over the past few months that is into this kind of shit, who could've stashed it in your apartment without you being aware? A friend? Neighbor? Anyone?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: (stiffens up, nods) But I can't believe he would ever do this to me ---

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: My cousin --- Christos.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He's a fucking pusher?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: He's into a lot of things that I don't want to know anything about.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: When was the last time he was in your place?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Three, four months ago.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Only way the police would be there is if he ratted you out to them. Luka starts breaking down.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: He'd never do that, he'd never do that.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Luka, what other explanation is there?

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: What am I going to do?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Look brother, a situation like this, you don't have many options. But I think I can help. Nate kneels to his pack, undoes the secret flap in the st and pulls out a wad of cash and offers it to Luka ---  75.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's 5 grand. Pack your stuff, wake up Stavros on his boat and get out of here, now --- (puts cash in Luka's hand) You gotta disappear for the next 6 months. Just get lost, lay low. Don't go anywhere near Athens.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: That's insane. If Christos did this to me, I'm going to confront him.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You can't go anywhere near your cousin ever again. Not even a fucking phone call. He'll bury you.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: Athens is my home, I've done nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The fuck does that have to do with anything? (off Luka's silence) Luka, please, I'm trying to save your life. You gotta trust me. Travel around, experience some shit. By winter this will all have blown over.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: He's right. And I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: I don't want you to do that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: I don't care. (takes Luka's hand) We'll make an adventure out of it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: What about Dom?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: She'll be fine. I'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: LUKA
dialogues.text: How can I repay you?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Keep safe. Be happy. And stay away from your cousin. Luka and Alexa give Nate a hug.  76.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXA
dialogues.text: Will you be there when we get back?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I don't know. But if I'm not, I'll make sure you know how to find me. As Luka and Alexa disappear inside, we can see Dom is no longer there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate sits on the sand staring at the water --- he looks f up and far from home. Dom approaches, sits next to him.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Where is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Gone. There was a phone call late last night, Luka had a family emergency. He and Alexa left.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Oh my God, that's terrible. Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I don't know. I hope so. (beat) I get how awkward this must be for you. There's a boat leaving at noon, you can take it.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: So what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: It all depends.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Alexa and the girls think you are a fugitive, that this is why you don't talk about yourself or your past ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Well neither do you. What does that make you? What are you hiding?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Touche. But how am I supposed to be comfortable around a man I know nothing about?  77.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Forget about what you know. How do you feel around me? Do you feel safe? Do you feel good?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Isn't that enough? Do we really need to know each other to enjoy this place together?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: How is that supposed to work? We don't talk?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No, we just don't ask questions about each other's lives. (off her hesitancy) C'mon, lay your armor down, just for the weekend. You can put it back on when we get back to Athens. Dom considering. She looks past, sees the graffiti on Mam

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Today is life, tomorrow never comes. Nate glances back at it, turns to Dom, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Why not? She meets his smile. It's a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just off the coast, incredible white rock formations jut of the water. Nate and Dom tool around on a boat with an outboard motor... Arcing around a stone pillar, they pass underneath a series of massive natural archways --- Nate steers through a tiny opening between 2 formations i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge natural swimming pool hidden by rock walls, a tiny strip of beach at the end. Nate and Dom gaze around in wo LATER: Nate and Dom laying back on a white blanket under rigged canopy, remnants of a picnic, water lapping the sa a few feet away. Dom's wearing his hat, staring at him.  78.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You ever gonna give me my hat back?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I like your hat.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I like my hat on you. He opens his eyes and meets her stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom peruse the farmers market, tasting produce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom watches from the veranda as Nate expertly chops tomat and cooks squid over a propane flame inside. MUSIC and VO from the beach emanate in the background. Nate finishes assembling the plates. He walks them out to the veranda and places them on the candle-lit table.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: This is beautiful, thank you. Nate sees she's surprised and impressed by the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: My grandparents. (off her look) That's who taught me about food, how to cook. I was raised by them. My grandfather was a produce wholesaler, my grandmother was always in the kitchen. It was through cooking that she expressed her love --- (cuts a little grin) I was a fat fuckin' kid. She giggles, uncharacteristically easy.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: It must have been wonderful to be loved like that.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. They did their best to compensate for the fact that my mom... And my father, well...

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: My father died when I was very young. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I only have the vaguest memory of him. I lost my mother at 17, which is when I had to stop dancing --- (stops herself) You know what, let's not do this. Share our sad stories --- Nate nods in agreement --- waits for her to take a bite, enjoys watching her savor the food. LATER: Dom finishes clearing the last plate. Tension smol inside her. She turns around, Nate is in the doorway, sta at her. Both feeling something visceral, both nervous abo it. To cut the tension, Nate smirks ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Fuck me if I'm wrong, but dinosaurs still exist, right? She takes a step towards him, vulnerable --- whispers ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Stop it. He steps close enough to kiss her -- hovering -- until ne can take it -- they kiss. Quickly turning hungry, consumi Dom comes alive in ways we only saw when she was dancing. He lifts her, her legs straddling around him. She yanks h shirt off as he carries her into the BEDROOM, lays her on the bed. Dropping his pants, he TEARS her dress off. As he feasts on Dom --- her lips, her neck, her breasts - his hand slides between her legs and begins to get her of Her body contorts as the ecstatic pressure builds, until she's gasping, quaking, losing her mind in a cataclysmic orgasm -- perhaps her first ever with another man. Fueled by her pleasure, he positions himself between her legs, but looking down at her he stops -- Her gasps have given way to restrained, barely-audible so tears streaking a face so fragile it may shatter. He look at her like a wounded little girl and she closes up, trem She weeps uncontrollably as she starts pulling away, but Nate won't let her. Intuitively understanding, he cradles her, whispering into her ear, though we can't hear his wo We HEAR Music, Eric Satie's "Gnossienne's No. 1" --- and strange sounds: electronic hiss, audio distortion --- hea breathing, grunts --- carrying us into...  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in the flickering light of a TV, Egorov sits on hi couch, staring with disturbing intensity directly at us. Sipping vodka. Satie record playing on console behind him Distorted voices emanate from the TV, a BRITISH MAN and a WOMAN speaking French-accented English --

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S., VIDEO)
dialogues.text: You're nothing --- say it. ARCING AROUND THE EDGE OF THE ROOM --- slowly revealing t TV SCREEN, hooked up to a primitive VCR --- After a few pained, ecstatic GRUNTS, the man replies ---

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH MAN, (0.S., VIDEO)
dialogues.text: I'm nothing. We can finally make out the video -- dark, grainy surveil footage -- a bedroom -- the man on all fours while the wo kneels behind him, pegging him in the ass with a strap-on

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (VIDEO)
dialogues.text: And what am I? After a few rugged thrusts, we catch a quick glimpse of t woman as she glances towards the camera -- it's Dom --

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH MAN, (VIDEO)
dialogues.text: Everything. A sudden KNOCK on Egorov's door. Surprised, he gets up, s off the tv and music. He opens his front door, revealing right-hand man Kosolov --- Egorov lets him in.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: We found something --- something compelling ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Korchnoi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom trek up a dirt road through strange volcanic landscape. Dom's wearing his hat. Nate's got a day pack o  81.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I don't know what happened to me last night ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You don't need to explain.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I can't imagine what you must think. Nate stops, turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I feel sorry for people who never go crazy -- Screws fall out all the time. We're all fucked up inside --- that's what makes us us. Dom looks at Nate with soul-stirred awe.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: You still must be disappointed ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Whaddya talkin' about? It was the best sex I never had. Dom throws her arms around him and kisses him passionatel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom come down a rocky path to an ancient, domed white-washed building with a blue door. To the left of th building is a huge pond of bubbling volcanic mud and wate Stripping to their bathing suits, she takes his hand as t step into the mud. Squishing down, Dom smiles, tripped ou Nate CHUCKS a chunk of mud at her. She screams, picks up handful and pegs him back. They exchange mud throws, scre and laughing, until they wrestle and collapse together. They make out and spread mud over each other. Sensual. Covering their entire bodies.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: LATER: Nate and Dom lay out, mud caked onto them. He stan grabs a loofa from his bag, leads her into the domed buil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shafts of steamy light cut through holes in the domed cei Thermal water flows from pipes into two rock bathtubs.  82. Nate climbs into the tub and offers his hand. She stares the tub, anxiety welling in her eyes... until she looks a Nate, lets go of all of it, takes his hand and gets in... and it's okay, she's okay. Dom leans back into Nate as he gently scrubs the dried mu off her. They switch, Dom starts scrubbing him ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: It's our last night. Nate nods, clearly upset by that.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom are sitting inside the ruins of the DREAM TE blankets and pillows laid out, wine and food. They're loo out as the sun disappears over the sea, an epic vista ina mystical place, but the mood has turned somber ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Let's stay longer. Just a few more days ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I need to go back. (off his look) I don't have the freedom you do.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What, are you married? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: We had an agreement. No questions.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So we just bury all of this, how we're feeling right now ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's complicated ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Shit! Tense, Nate gets up, walks to the edge of the temple.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know -- a few months ago a friend asked me what I truly want outta life, who do I wanna be. (Beat) I couldn't give any fuckin' answers, not one.  83.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Which makes you no different than most of us...

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: But that's the thing. I always wanted to be different --- I've just been so caught up in the bullshit of being me, I somehow lost who I am --- (turns to Dom) I know you know exactly what I'm talking about ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Maybe it's all that matters. (off her silence) You're not sayin' anything, but you're screamin' inside, and I can hear it.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Why are you making things more difficult? Nate sits down next to her, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You're my favorite new feeling. I just don't wanna lose it. Dom spoons Nate, wraps her arms around him and whispers -

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Let's sleep --- and perhaps in our dreams our souls will be cured --- we'll wake up whole again, with the answer of how to live our lives. CAMERA PANS UP TO THE STARS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE OVER THE QUAYS: A cloudy day. Arrivals, depart Nate and Dom disembark their ferry and head to the street ANGLE CLOSE ON NATE AND DOM -- the energy between them is sputtered, confused, tense... Neither knows how to part w

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: This is fucking stupid. I don't even know where you're staying, how to find you --- your number --- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (off her silence) Lemme give you a lift home.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Better if I take a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Look --- meet me tomorrow night at the Paris Cinema in the Plaka --- they're playing the new Kubrick film. After a hesitant beat, Dom writes her number on her ferry stub and hands it to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Phone me if something comes up.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (kisses her and smiles) See you tomorrow night.. Dom watches a happy Nate head off towards the parking lot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drizzling. Nate drives through Exarcheia, blocks from hom Nate notices fresh graffiti on a derelict building: a red "A" within a circle. A signal. He shifts to hyper-alert S MODE. Checking mirrors, surroundings. Passing his street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring rain. Nate slips into a run-down office building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soaked, Nate heads down a hall to the door of an accounti firm, knocks. A beat, door opens, Gable ushers him into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forsyth is inside, waiting. Gable shuts and locks door, t Nate an intense look.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: You sure you're black?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Been running non-stop for 8 hours --

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: You wanna explain what the hell happened with Luka?  85.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You tell me. I woke up Sunday, Luka and his girl had split for points unknown, and then I found out your guy on Athens PD jumped the gun, tossed his place the night we left.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Haridopolos said he was just followin’ the instructions you gave him.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: C'mon, and you believe that shit? After all the work I put in, why would I blow the bust like this?

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause your heart wasn't in it. You didn't want to put the kid in the harness --

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: If I was gonna cut him loose, I would've come up with something a little smarter, Marty. My fingerprints wouldn't be on it.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: We don't have time to deal with it right now, but we are gonna deal with it, and I'm gonna put you on the box.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Good, fine, that's your prerogative, Chief. Forsyth eyes Nate, trying to read him for deception. Afte beat, he gestures Nate to follow him. Nate follows Gable and Forsyth into a BACK OFFICE BULLPEN

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would someone tell me what's going on? And as if to answer, we hear a BELCH from in the bathroom a FLUSH -- someone quickly washing hands and then the doo opens -- in steps SY BENFORD, head of the CIA's SOVIET/EA DIVISION. In his 50s, imposing, serious, tough. Seeing Benford, Nate's face contorts with the dread of wh he thinks this means...

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is he dead --- ?  86.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Then what --- they rolled him up? Benford takes out a folded piece of paper, hands it to Na

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: Moscow received this unscheduled burst from Marble four days ago. Nate reads the text carefully, looks up excited.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: So Istanbul --- tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: I don't know --- I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: There are no duress indicators in the syntax, verbiage or punctuation...

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: In all the years we've had Marble, he's never done anything like this -- a last minute emergency face to face? It's totally out of character. Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Clearly something's wrong --- but that doesn't mean the ask isn't legit.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: He's setting the time, the location, everything ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Of course he is. You assholes fucked him over. Why should he trust you?

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: How do you know he didn't send this with a Line KR gun to his head?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Because what I know is something a craven motherfucker like you will never understand --- (gets into Benford's face) If they had a gun to his head, he woulda made them pull the trigger before setting me up.  87.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: (after a beat) All right, we'll spend the night at Hellenikon Air Base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pouring rain and occasional thunder continues. Elena resting on an old couch, Dom is staring out the window at Nate's darkened apartment.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I can't remember the last time there was a summer storm like this in Athens ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I find it comforting --- as though there are moments when even mother nature can't handle the pressure -- Elena looks at Dom, can see there is a lot on her mind.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: It's been 11 hours since you got back -- where is he? What is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: He's probably still debriefing his superiors -- dealing with the consequences of letting Luka go --

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Hard not to admire what he did --- (after a long beat) Does it make it harder for you, knowing that he's a decent man?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Just like our eyes, our hearts have a way of adjusting to the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I hope for your sake that his act of conscience doesn't cause his superiors to send him back to America --- Dom nods --- but we can see in her eyes that perhaps she hopes that they do.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I'll know when I see him tomorrow night.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korchnoi's street. Late. Quiet. A VOLGA WITH FOUR MEN pul over and parks. Kosolov, Egorov and TWO TEAM MEMBERS carrying large brief get out and enter an apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing gloves, one of Egorov's guys speed-picks the door an apartment --- opening it, they all step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kosolov and Team#1 photograph every inch of Korch's apart Egorov examining the photos on the console table: He ling briefly on a shot of a younger Korch on a hunting trip wi three men, including the Defense Minister. Team#2 looks through a side table with a few books, an as tray and the TRANSISTOR RADIO. He flips through the books looking for anything, puts them back. He picks up the rad Egorov looks at Korch's record player when suddenly a bur of SQUELCH and MUSIC -- Egorov turns to Team#2 holding th radio, shooting him a look like, "Stop fucking around." T turns the radio off, puts it down. Kosolov's crouched in a coat closet, over an open box. Eg peers over his shoulder to see career memorabilia careles thrown into it: photos with Brezhnev, certificates, etc.. Kosolov opens a small case, shows Egorov a tarnished MEDA

dialogues.speaker: KOSOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: The Order of Suvorov. Never thought I'd see one of these in person.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: How proud he is of it. Egorov continues perusing. Casually scans a bookshelf. Un he locks in on a particular book. He pulls it out. His ey electric with excitement, Egorov holds up the book to Kos

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: The collected poems of Pavel Markova --- (wags book, subtle grin) Eventually everything connects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incognito in a drab suit, hat and thick glasses, Korch em from the airport with a small bag, flags a taxi.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old, forested residential neighborhood on the outskirt of Istanbul that sits on a hill overlooking the Bosphorus CLOSE ON THE SARIYER HOTEL, a fading beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacious living room with a grand view of the Bosphorus. door opens and Korch totes his bag inside to find MAXIM VOLONTOV, the GRU Rezident (Chief) of the GRU, 50s, risin from an arm chair with a grin, the men embrace.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (looks around the room) This hotel never changes, does it?

dialogues.speaker: VOLONTOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Many excellent memories, yes?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: If things go well today with the German, you and I will make more memories tonight ---

dialogues.speaker: VOLONTOV
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'm only too happy to accommodate you, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a window, we see Nate, Benford, Gable and two PIL eating around various maps, deep in conversation. Nate ex himself, saunters out. Nate strolls down the hall, slips into another office. He pulls out Dom's number and dials the phone. The line RING

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon, pick up. Phone RINGS, but nobody's home. Frustrated, Nate hangs up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opulent office of a Kremlin powerbroker. Egorov's sit coolly in front of the desk as the Defense Minister paces back and forth like an angry bull.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: What did you think was going to happen when we started this?  90.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: You started this ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: And you empowered me ---

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I never authorized you to conduct a search of General Vladimir Korchnoi's home!

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: It's him. I'm certain of it.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: And you're basing this on what, a book of poetry?! Korchnoi has dedicated his life to the service of this country. One of our great heroes -- and the staunchest of hardliners.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Yes. And what better cover could a traitor have?

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I've known this man for over 40 years ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Then you're aware of the tragedy that befell his wife?

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Let me ask you --- if your wife was deathly ill during your posting in London, and all you had to do was walk her down the street to a hospital to receive life-saving treatment ---

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I know what happened ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: He had to watch her die because Kruschev felt it would be too embarrassing if her life were saved by a treatment developed in the west.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: We've all had to make terrible sacrifices for this country. Except perhaps you. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (hard look) You will not turn this man's heartbreak into your smoking gun.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Did you see the daily brief out of Greece this morning? Benford is in Athens. As is Nash.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Korchnoi is traveling right now. I'd like to know where and why.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: We're done with this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: With all due respect, I believe your friendship with him is clouding your judgment.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE MINISTER, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: And I believe your lust for power is clouding yours. This is Vladimir Korchnoi you insolent little prick --- and you bring me this circumstantial shit!? Unless you have overwhelming, incontrovertible proof, I don't want to ever hear you utter his name again. The Defense Minister storms out, leaving the unflappable Egorov rattled for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom in front of the Cine Paris outdoor movie theater, sca for Nate as a few LATECOMERS rush in for the 7pm BARRY LY We hear TRAILERS playing on the rooftop screen. Glancing her watch: 7:20. Disappointed and concerned, Dom heads in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bright, full moon. A Grumman HU-16 Albatross Seaplane f above the Aegean, its ID numbers covered up. Two pilots up front --- Nate and Benford seated alone in back. Benford gazes out the window at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: Goddamn full moon. Couldn't of picked a worse night for this shmovert op ---  92. Benford reaches into a bag, pulls out a tiny, covert microphone/wire device --- holds it out to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd like you to wear this ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, I'd like to titty bang Raquel Welch while eating a porter- house steak. Doesn't mean it's ever gonna happen. Over the ENGINE HUM, MUSIC and LAUGHTER carries us into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korch and Volontov enjoy a decadent room service dinner w two voluptuous TURKISH HOOKERS, laughing, getting wasted

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Another drink ---

dialogues.speaker: VOLONTOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Yes! Pretending to be drunk, Korch lumbers to a credenza, open another bottle of vodka. He surreptitiously takes out a t vial of clear liquid -- as he pours four shots, he stealt mixes in doses from the vial into three of the glasses. Korch pockets the vial just as Volontov staggers over, le in and gestures to the Hookers.

dialogues.speaker: VOLONTOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Does the General have a preference for the evening? Korch hands Volontov one of the spiked glasses and takes clean one for himself --- and raises it for a toast.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Maxim, you old wolfhound, I applaud you on a beautiful operation! (smiles) The preference is entirely yours. Beaming, Volontov clinks his glass and they gulp their sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egorov pulls up on his motorcycle in front the massive ne classical Stalinki apartment block for Moscow's elite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SWEET GRANDMOTHER in her 70's opens the door to find Eg  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grandmother ushers Egorov into the study and leaves. ALEXEI RUBANOV, late 70s, a sweet, rumpled Kremlin powerbroker, sits in an armchair as his TODDLER GRANDSON play at his feet. Rubanov motions Egorov to sit.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Alexei -- thank you for seeing me on short notice.

dialogues.speaker: RUBANOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: It is quite alright, Ivan ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (gestures to toddler) And who is this little one?

dialogues.speaker: RUBANOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: My grandson, Viktor --- Egorov smiles at the little boy... A beat...

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I hope you've been in good health and spirits.

dialogues.speaker: RUBANOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Good enough. And you, your trajectory at the Center continues it's rise? Special projects for the Collegium --- (off Egorov's nod) You've positioned yourself well. Rubanov rolls a toy to his Grandson. Smiles at him adorin

dialogues.speaker: RUBANOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: So what brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: General Vladimir Korchnoi is traveling at the moment. I wish to know his exact whereabouts and the nature of his activity.

dialogues.speaker: RUBANOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: This information is classified beyond your realm.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Yes, but not yours. I'd like you to find out for me --- right now. Rubanov gawks at Egorov like he's nuts.  94.

dialogues.speaker: RUBANOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Your perverse attempt at a joke? Egorov answers with his eyes. Rubanov's baffled and incen The toddler giggles and babbles as he plays with his toy. Smiling, Egorov picks the boy up, begins to bounce him on his knee -- speaking to him in a overly sweet tone.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Viktor, such a beautiful boy -- your grandfather loves you dearly -- yes -- as he does all beautiful boys -- boys not much older than yourself. When you become a man, what will you think when you see the photos of your grandfather viciously sodomizing these children -- robbing them of their youth, their dignity, their lives? Will you still love him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubanov's horrified as Egorov hands the boy over to him.

dialogues.speaker: RUBANOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: I settled this account with your father another lifetime ago. Those photos, the negatives, he assured me they were destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: He lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volontov and the two Hookers are unconscious on the couch Korch slaps each in the face to make sure they're out. Korch then opens the window, outside of which is a fire- escape. He climbs out, closes window, heads up to roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korch stalks across the roof to the edge, jumps across th gap to the next building and disappears down its fire esc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Seaplane lands on the calm Bosphorus along an uninhab stretch of wooded shoreline. Moving into a shielded inlet the plane cuts its engines and anchors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate in a commando dinghy, engine muffled by a blanket -- zooms up onto a rocky beach, jumps out, pulls the boat in the cover of trees. Grabbing his gear, he rolls out on fo  95. Nate stalks to the top of a steep hill, beyond which is a small bay -- built along its banks is the rotting majesty an abandoned 19th-century Turkish waterfront mansion or Y Nate pulls his binoculars, scans the area and continues o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate skirts around the yali to find a huge window missing its glass. He turns on a red-filtered flashlight, climbs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate prowls through the decrepit ballroom with a magnific river view. Footsteps CREAKING. RATS SCURRYING. Tension. He glimpses a reflection in a cracked mirror and flinches he sees himself -- and behind him, Korch. Nate spins arou Glad to see each other, they smile. Nate steps in for a hug, but Korch holds him off.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I didn't know they were putting a Keyhole above Vorkuta. The fuckers kept it from me ‘cause they knew I'd tip you.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: How bad was the blowback?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Most are convinced it was a technical breach. But there is at least one element in the Center pursuing the possibility of a mole ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Are you in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: You tell me. Korch pulls out a photo -- the code on the back indicatin it's the one from Athens that freaked him out. He hands i to Nate, who angles his flashlight on a distant surveilla photo of himself, Luka, the girls and Dom, right after th bird shit on him, everyone laughing. Stunned, Nate looks up at Korch.  96.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Her name is Dominika Egorov -- An operations officer that was also trained as a sparrow ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Fuck me --- Korch pulls out a UV scope --- scans Nate head to toe. Ko then snaps off the UV scopes lens exposing the light and holds it up to Nate --- shirt and shoes glow with flecks spy dust, confirming the worst.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you knew she was on me, why did you risk this meet? Why didn't you just send a burst saying I'd been compromised?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: I don't trust the people you work for. I didn't know how they might use it --- Nate spinning out under the weight of what it all means -

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need you to walk me through everything, from the beginning. LATER: Korch and Nate sit on the windowsill, gazing out a the water. Nate wracked with guilt, devastation and shame

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We all crave intimacy -- we are all vulnerable to our desires ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: This wasn't like that -- I mean shit, we never even had sex -- which is maybe why I didn't see it coming -- (looks at Korch) It felt like something else -- something intense and mutual --

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Love?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: All I know is it felt true.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
