dialogues.text: Which is precisely what sparrows are trained to do. Create the illusion that it's real.  97.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: This was different.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: You know what goes on in these schools?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've heard all the crazy stories about the sex ---

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: It's much more than sex. The training these women receive systematically makes them incapable of experiencing any true emotion, except perhaps fear.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The emotions I saw in this girl were too complex to manufacture --- nobody's that good of an actress.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Do you recall the suicide of Francoise Guillot back in March?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The NATO guy, slit his wrists in the tub --- ?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: I'm sure he thought it was real as well. As did all of her targets. She's quite talented, this one. Nate looks over at Korch and gets up ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Well then that's it --- you're comin' with me. We'll exfil you right now.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Out of the question. (off Nate's look) Defecting would take the power out of everything I've done. If and when they come, I want to look them in the eyes. I want the satisfaction of knowing they know.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The fuck is that satisfaction worth? Korch doesn't respond. Nate's so frustrated he looks like wants to smash something. He takes a breath.  98.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have a tap on a trunk line linking the Ministry of Defense with some of your key research facilities, including Vorkuta. If they want a technical breach, I can give this to you wrapped in a bow. Use it to cover your ass.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: It can't come from me. There'll be too many questions.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Then I'll get it done from our side.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Knowing the value of that tap, I highly doubt you'll be successful, but if you were, it might help. Korch checks his watch, gets up.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How much are you going to tell Benford?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: But the consequences ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter anymore. I'm done with all this shit. I want out of everything -- for good.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: (proud smile) I'm so glad to hear this --- nothing could make me happier. Nate looks down, struggling not to lose his shit.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nathan --- look at me --- (Nate looks at him) No matter what happens, in the book of my life, you will always be my second favorite chapter. They share a tearful moment.  99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plane's in the air. Benford's sitting in a doomstruck meditation, face like a clenched fist. Nate's next to him hunched forward --- boiling down.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell us about this girl?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I'm supposed to tell you guys about every piece of ass I chase? It didn't feel like she was working me. I fucked up ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: You're the one who started this whole thing, by allowing DCI Bush to put a keyhole over Vorkuta, just so he could look good for the president --- might as well have held up a big fucking neon sign to the Sovs, "you have a breach!"

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: I did everything I could short of resigning to stop them ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: That what you tell yourself so you can sleep at night?

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: (explodes ) Hey, I fucking bleed inside for every agent we lose!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Then help me figure this out. Benford gets up and paces around.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: They've probably had a team ghosting you since you first arrived in Greece --- You missed your date, she knows you haven't been home yet. (Beat) As soon as her cousin Egorov knows that Marble traveled and where, our boy is cooked.  100.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Egorov's still a few steps behind us. We have time to make a move ---

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: What move?

dialogues.speaker: NATE

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE, WINDOWLESS ROOM, WALLS
dialogues.text: still hooded, in his underwear, bolted to the floor. Arms, legs restraints. A video camera on a Dom tries to restrain her shock COVERED IN BLANKETS. Nate, sitting in a metal armchair and chest secured with leather tripod aimed at him. and dismay.

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: (IN RUSSIAN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have done nothing. I am not here. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is our comrades with November 17 who procured him and will claim responsibility. Egorov nods at the guard, who unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom and Egorov enter, the guard closes, locks the door. D stands frozen as Egorov removes Nate's hood. Face swollen crusted in blood, Nate squints, trying to get oriented. Getting his bearings, Nate sees Egorov, then sees Dom --- Nate and Dom are trying to not betray any emotion. Egorov motions for Dom to sit in the chair against the wa behind the camera.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: Your last name, Nash --- you of course know what it means in Russian.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Ours.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: Yes. But it has another meaning, specific to the Kontora. When we say someone is a "nash," it means he is one of ours... An agent of ours. The irony is thick, yes? (off Nate's silence) I am Lieutenant Colonel Ivanovich Egorov. I am very please to finally meet you. A large suitcase rests on a card table. Egorov opens it, reaches under the clothes, pulls up a secret flap to expo an array of medical equipment. He carefully removes and arranges each item on the table. Egorov straps a blood pressure monitor around Nate's arm, pumps it up, takes his pressure and pulse.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Department 12 of S Directorate has come a long way from the prehistoric days of intravenous ethanol, sodium thiopental, scopolamine. The problem with potent, short and intermediate- acting hypnotics has always been reliability --- yes? Egorov moves back to the table picks up an INJECTION GUN affixes a needle to it. Grabs an ampule of clear liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although they encourage talkativeness, it is next to impossible to discern the fact from the fiction in a subject's blabberings. Moving back to Nate, he holds up the ampule for him to se

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is what makes SP-117 so special. Egorov snaps the ampule into the gun. Nate goes nuts tryi to bust free, straining so hard his nose starts bleeding. Egorov waits for Nate to give up, then jams the needle in his neck, injects the liquid, and stands back.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it won't put you into a twilight. You'll be completely lucid, but your imagination is inhibited --- like a zoom on a camera lens, SP-117 forces the subject to focus on only that which they believe to be true. Interestingly enough, it barely has an effect on women --- something to do with hormones. (hard glance at Dom) But we're working on this. After glancing at his watch, Egorov puts the gun down, re with a retinascope and checks Nate's eyes. The drug is al starting to work --- Nate is trying to breath through it. Egorov turns on the video camera, waits patiently for a b

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mister Nash, I'd like to start by having you answer a simple question. (beat) What is the color of the falling snow? Nate is breathing hard, trying to fight the drug.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Answer the question. (beat) What is the color of the falling snow?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Red. Nate suddenly starts laughing but is still fighting.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: What is the color of the falling snow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weaker ) Red. Egorov checks his watch again, waits a beat. Observes the drug taking over, Nate becoming tranquil.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: What is the color of the falling snow? (Beat) What is the color of the falling snow?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: --- White ---

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: Yes. Very good. Now we can begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloodthirsty Gable rumbles into the Soviet Embassy and the DESK CLERK. ARMED SOLDIERS sentried around the room.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Yuri Petrov --- tell him Marty Gable is here to see him. The CLERK doesn't know what to do. Gable SLAMS his hand d on the desk and thunders ---

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yuri fucking Petrov!!! Right now!!! FEW MINUTES LATER: Gable pacing. The burly, bespectacled REZIDENT, YURI PETROV approaches Gable, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: PETROV
dialogues.text: This is most unusual. What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Oh, like you don't fuckin' know!?

dialogues.speaker: PETROV
dialogues.text: Martin ---

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Shut your dick-trap and listen to me! Anything happens to our guy Nash, if he isn't returned to us in perfect condition within 24 hours, bodies are gonna start dropping and this cold war's gonna go very fuckin' hot.  120.

dialogues.speaker: PETROV
dialogues.text: Martin, you've got to calm down. I swear to you on the souls of my children, we had nothing to do with --- Gable savagely BITCH SLAPS Petrov -- the Soldiers rush ov but a stunned Petrov gestures them to hold off ---

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: 24 hours -- Gable blows out. Disturbed, Petrov rushes back upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: --- Burst transmission... Benford, he told me after I came back.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: So when and where did you meet with General Korchnoi?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Tuesday night, July 12th, in Istanbul.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: (looks back at Dom) So you did not see Dominique at all the evening of July 12th?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: We had a date... I never showed.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: What was discussed at your meeting with Korchnoi?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I didn't know about the Keyhole. They were searching for a technical breach --- but also a mole hunt. Dominique. Korchnoi told me she was a Center ops officer --- trained as a sparrow --- but it felt real...

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: What felt real?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Us...

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: Us meaning you thought you were in love with each other?  121.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: (looking back at Dom) Perhaps you were. (turns back to Nate) What else did you and Korchnoi talk about?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I wanted to exfil him, but he refused. The line tap near Valensky bridge...

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I told Korchnoi we would blow it to give him cover...

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV
dialogues.text: And there's been no further contact with Korchnoi subsequent to Istanbul?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No. Egorov breaks into a big inward smile. He shuts off the camera, pulls the tape --- which he slides into his bag alongside FOUR OTHER TAPES. Egorov snaps another ampule into the injection gun and sh Nate up --- his body surges alive like shocked with electricity --- gasping for breath --- hyperawake. Nate's looking at Egorov like, "What the fuck just happened?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egorov packs his equipment, zips his bag, carries it to N

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Thank you for your candor and cooperation. I'll be sure to give General Korchnoi your regards. Realizing what he's given up, Nate's senses capsize --- melting down with rage and anguish, he starts SCREAMING! Egorov looks at Nate with empathy, then gestures to Dom.

dialogues.speaker: EGOROV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Let's go. Dom follows Egorov to the door. He KNOCKS. The door swing open. As they step out, the guard, disturbed by Nate's in screaming, peeks in, then closes the door, locks it.  122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Egorov heads to the main room, Dom stands outside the metal door, covering her face, wallowing in Nate's SCREAM Egorov reaches the end of the hall, glances back at her, shakes his head before disappearing into the main room. Dom suddenly WHIPS around, V-strikes the Guard in the nec with savage force, CRUSHING his trachea. He drops, gaspin Dom yanks away his AK and SLEDGEHAMMERS him in the head - knocking him out -- Nate's screams covering the sound ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egorov quietly talking with Christos as the rest of the Terrorists lounge around. Christos glances over Egorov's shoulder, freezes --- the other guys look over --- Dom leveling the AK --- she opens up with controlled burs muzzle flashing in a strobe light of death --- as she dro everyone in the room, including Egorov, she strafes the w hot lead igniting the curtains --- As the flames grow, Dom aims on the door, waiting --- the door swings open and she BLOWS THE LOOKOUT AWAY. She stands breathing, close to overloading. Getting it together, she's about to fire a kill shot into Egorov whe bloodied Christos sweeps her legs --- she slams down onto coffee table, which collapses --- Christos is immediately on her, pummeling her -- blood gu from his thigh and shoulder wounds as he starts chocking her. She tries to push him off with one hand -- flails he other hand out, desperately trying to grab whatever she c Dom clasps a pen, JAMS it into the bullet hole in Christo thigh --- as he recoils in agony, she grabs the back of h head, pulls him in tight to her face and drives the blood pen straight into his ear as deep as she can --- Christos SHRIEKS and withers --- Dom scrambles up, grabs pistol and finished him off --- The room is filling with smoke --- she grabs Egorov's bag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dom busts in, smoke flowing with her. Nate's stunned. She unbuckles him and he struggles to his feet. They flee ---  123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom struggle through the smoky room. She stops, remembering --- looking for the bag, she notices Egorov i gone. She scans around, sees a blood trail out of the hou Nate pulls her to the door, grabbing Lookout's AK on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom emerge from the burning house into predawn n a car is missing -- In the distance, Nate sees red-tailli speeding down the dirt road towards a highway. Nate pushes Dom to the passenger side of an Old Mercedes runs around to the drivers side, gets in. He rips out the ignition wires, hot wires it... Nate tears the car back, spins it around and hauls ass in pursuit, no lights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egorov careens onto the two-lane highway, his bag on the passenger seat. He's a mess, barely able to drive, close delirious -- bullet wounds in his upper chest and right l oozing blood. Every time he shifts gears he SCREAMS in pa Nitro in his veins, Nate stomps the gas, speed shifts, an cranks the wheel so the car slides onto the highway and t after Egorov --- Dom getting tossed around --- The Fiat's engine whining as Egorov fights through sweat blood to keep his shit together. Checks the rear view, se the dim outline of the Mercedes, doesn't know what it is. Nate gunning it full bore, gaining on Egorov. He slides t AK to Dom. She HAMMERS the windshield with the butt of the gun, spiderwebbing the glass. SMASHES it again. Then leans bac in her seat and kicks out the glass. The wind RUSHES IN. Just as Egorov hits an incline, he checks his rear view, recognizes the Mercedes bearing down on him --- As the hill steepens near the top, the Fiat engine scream in protest. He checks the mirror: the Mercedes is closing Egorov throttles over the crest. Olive groves on both sid of him, he kills his lights, hangs a left onto a dirt roa and cuts through the trees. As Nate crests the hill, he's lost sight of Egorov ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is he?  124. Dom spots the dust cloud between the olive trees ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: There! But they're already past the turn-off --- Nate slams the brakes --- Dom is hurled up against the dash. He spins th car around and mashes the gas, hitting the dirt road. The Mercedes bounces along the rough trail as the dust cl their car --- Nate and Dom shielding their eyes --- tryin to keep track of the taillights ahead of them --- HIGH ANGLE OVER DIRT ROAD The dawning sun igniting the sc dust clouds pluming ahead as Nate tears ass after Egorov CAMERA PANS UP TO REVEAL: just beyond the end of the road and olive groves is the CORINTH CANAL --- 70-feet wide an four miles long, the canal's vertical hard rock walls dro 300 feet into the water below. Thirty feet away from plowing into the canal, EGOROV slow using all of his strength to crank his wheel right, he sl onto an even dustier dirt road running parallel to the cl Nate makes the same move --- the dust consuming the car -

dialogues.speaker: DOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't see anything ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter --- he's right in front of us --- light him up! Dom sprays fire into the dust cloud --- Egorov going full bore, hears the gunfire - shots CLANGIN into his car --- POP --- a bullet to the tire ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Dom see the Fiat burst from the dust cloud in a murderous barrel roll ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Nate gears down just as the Fiat careens over the cliff.. The Fiat plummets hundreds of feet --- when it hits the w the car SHATTERS APART. Nate and Dom running from their car to cliff's edge --- looking down at the sinking, mangled Fiat carcass --- Standing in utter silence, Dom is reeling.  125.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gotta go. Nate takes her hand to pull her, but she doesn't move ---

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: I must go to the Soviet Embassy. If I don't come in --- if I don't go back, my sister will pay the price. This can't happen. Bloody tears streaking down her cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Look, we'll figure it out --- but right now we gotta get out of here. Nate puts his arm around her, guides her to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sokolov bursts into Korch's office...

dialogues.speaker: SOKOLOV, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: Have you heard about Athens?

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI, (IN RUSSIAN)
dialogues.text: (stiffens up) No.... Tell me everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate is in a phone booth, chinning the receiver, looking at Dom. They're both cleaned up, wearing poorly fitting s clothes, but their faces are battered.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: No one knows anything for the moment. It's still in the box. You can't let her turn herself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gable, Benford and Forsyth sit around a speaker phone in Forsyth's secure office.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: You need to calm her down. Buy us a little time to figure out the narrative, how to frame it ---

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: We got a safehouse in Loutraki -- 2402 Latridi. We'll get there as soon aS we can. You got it?  126.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nate hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: We play this right, there could be lot of upside ---

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: How long do we have?

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: 48 to 72 hours at the most ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moscow Chief Of Station Gondorff in disguise, wearing a w fake beard and peasant hat, huddles with Korch in the sha of a rail bridge that spans the Moscow River.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: She refuses to defect. She's adamant about coming back, facing the music, so nothing happens to her sister.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Then exfiltrate her sister.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: We could've done that before this happened, but now --- there's just too much heat.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: If she turns herself in, she'll be their sacrificial lamb. They'1l execute her.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: We've told her, but she's intransigent ---

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: Did she say why she did this? Why she saved him?

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: She cares about the guy --- Amazed, Korch shakes his head, smiling inwardly and mutte to himself in Russian ---

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think?  127.

dialogues.speaker: KORCHNOI
dialogues.text: (deep sigh) I think it's time that I retire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beachfront compound shielded from the street by large w There's a main house and guest house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate and Gable sit quietly in a study with a big desk, ch Nate gazes through the closed french doors into the livin room where Dom is in deep discussion with Forsyth and Ben The longer they take, the more uptight Nate gets.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I should be in there with her --- Nate sees Dom throw a concerned glance at him, then turn Gable and Forsyth and nod as if agreeing to something hea

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are they talking about? What'd they just get her to agree to?

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Will you stop with the bitching? You're giving me a fucking nose bleed. Dom, Forsyth and Benford get up. Dom looks back at Nate a the two men enter the study and close the doors. Nate stands in tense anticipation as Benford sits behind desk, Forsyth on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: She's going back.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The fuck, Sy!? She can't ---

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: We can't stop her --- but, we think we've worked out a move that can get her back safe and in the clear --- Benford stops... Not wanting to continue, he looks to For

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: She's got to go back a hero, Nate --- But there's only one way for her to do that. Nate realizes what he's saying, throws a glare at Benford  128.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Was this your idea, you sick twisted fuck?

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: No. It was his. Gondorff met with him last night, told him what happened --- Nate grabs the top of the wood chair in front of the desk for support, leans down as if overwhelmed with nausea.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: There's gotta be another way...

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: He's decided. This is what he wants. You gotta respect that. Nate shuts his eyes in dread --- GRIP TIGHTENS ON THE WOO And in an EXPLOSION OF RAGE AND FRUSTRATION, he begins SMASHING THE CHAIR against the desk. The men are mesmerized and disturbed as Nate demolishes t chair. Finally he collapses. Nobody knows what to do exce stand there. Dom watches from the living room, face filled with anguis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of CIA AGENTS open the gates. A car rolls in, th close the gates after. Gable and Dom get out of the car. Forsyth and Benford step out of the house to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: How'd the call go? You fed them the exact narrative we discussed?

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: I was standing right next to her at the pay phone. They bought it hook, line and sinker. Think she's underground, on the run.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: So the pick-up's set? Gable and Forsyth exchange a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Sy, I'll brief you on the details.

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTH
dialogues.text: He's upstairs. We had some dinner brought in for you both. Let's talk in the morning. Get some rest.  129. Forsyth, Gable, and Benford head over to the guest house Dom walks into the main house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate's laying on the bed, looking helpless and miserable. Dom pads in, sits on the bed next to him. He takes her ha

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What do you do when nothing in your life goes right?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: (softly) Go left.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: When's the pick-up?

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Midnight tomorrow. In Meteora.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Can't believe you're going back. (beat) I don't know how you're gonna get through this.

dialogues.speaker: DOM
dialogues.text: Imagining you imagining me --- this is how I will survive. They kiss passionately, slowly removing each other's clot and begin to make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate ushers Dom to the back of a UTILITY VAN with FOUR CI AGENTS dressed like average Greeks waiting inside. She's about to say something to him, but her eyes take ov and tell him what her voice can't. Nate leans in close an whispers something into her ear... They give each other a delicate kiss and hug for last tim Dom gets into the van. As it drives off through the gates Nate gets into a car with Gable and Benford. Gable tears out, heading in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed casually, a drunk Korch sits smoking and finishin glass of Old Rip Van Winkle. He stubs the cig out, stagge up, revealing a glimpse of a belly-holstered pistol.  130. Korch empties the rest of the bottle into his glass, take out a record, puts it on his turntable, drops the needle turns it up full blast. As the orchestral intro of Lee Hazlewood's "Sundown, Sund kicks in, Korch conducts with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: AN EPIC PAN
dialogues.text: OF METEORA, a majestic, forested mountain valley dotted w titanic sandstone buttes jutting thousands of feet high. two-lane highway snakes through the area. CLOSE ON DOM on the forest floor, hidden in a thicket of trees just off the road, eyeing the highway, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate, Gable, and Benford nestled on a mountainside lookin down at Dom's position through binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korch in his chair singing along with total abandon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MUSIC CONTINUES... Benford can see Nate's anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: They're gonna put her on the box, sweat her on every detail.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: She can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What if they don't buy it?

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: What's not to buy? She delivered Korchnoi to them on a silver platter.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: We're making a big deal out of this. The rest of the world's gonna think we got our asses outplayed by their top female ops officer.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: It's a fuckin' public relations bonanza for The Kremlin. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GABLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're gonna turn her into the superhero of every little girl and the wet dream of every little boy. She'll be bulletproof, the Center's new star. Suddenly, a set of headlights approaching from a couple m away at the end of the valley. Benford checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: It's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korch guzzles the rest of the Bourbon, rocking to the son THROUGH THE WINDOW BEHIND HIM: on the street, a phalanx o black cars pull up. A SMALL ARMY OF KGB pile out, rush in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUING. Through the trees, Dom sees the approac headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUING. Nate, Gable, and Benford watch as the C pulls over, kills its lights, and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUING. Dom cuts through the trees to the side the road. A MAN is waiting by the car's open back door. S gets in, he slams the door shut, but instead of hearing i we hear FISTS POUNDING ON A WOOD DOOR ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is kicked down --- a HOARD OF KGB AGENTS bust in followed by Sokolov --- to find Korch standing with a gun leveled at them. The KGB guys draw their guns. Sokolov and Korch lock in a grim, devastated gaze. Korch looks like he's about to pull the trigger --- but b he can, the KGB Agents fire --- and Korch is killed ina blaze of gunfire. A teary Sokolov turns off the record pl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything quiet, just the wind. Nate, Gable and Benford watch the car pull away and head down the road.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: He's gone ---  132.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: You don't know that ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I know him...

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: If Korchnoi ended it on his own terms, it was a good death.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Going out while getting blown by Pam Grier, that's a good death, not this. The men watch the car's tail lights receding in the dista Benford sees Nate's all broken up.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you'll see her again.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: In my dreams ---

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: She's agreed to work for us, Nate. Nate studies Benford's face, sees that it's real ---

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We want you to run her from Helsinki.

dialogues.speaker: GABLE
dialogues.text: Actually, we didn't want you involved at all, but it's the only way she'd let us put her in the harness --- Nate looks back out at the car. After a beat ---

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: As soon as the time is right, I'm getting her and her sister out.

dialogues.speaker: BENFORD
dialogues.text: That could be a while --- The tail lights disappear around a butte.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I know. Brian Eno's "NEEDLES IN THE CAMEL'S EYE" kicks in hard as we... CUT TO BLACK.
